2101830.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2101830
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 001
2101830.text: Narrated 'Abdullah bin 'Amr (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "The time of the Zuhr (noon) prayer is when the sun passes the meridian and a man's shadow is of the same length as his height. It lasts until the time of the 'Asr (afternoon) prayer. The time of the 'Asr prayer is as long as the sun has not become yellow (during its setting). The time of the Maghrib (sunset) prayer is as long as the twilight has not disappeared. The time of the 'Isha' (night) prayer is up to midnight. And the time of the Fajr (morning) prayer is from the appearance of dawn as long as the sun has not risen; (but when the sun rises abstain from prayer; for it rises between the two horns of Satan)." [Reported by Muslim].

2101840.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2101840
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 002
2101840.text: Narrated Buraidah (RA) in another version of the above Hadith regarding 'Asr (afternoon prayer): "When the sun is white and clear." [Reported by Muslim].

2101850.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2101850
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 003
2101850.text: And Abu Musa (RA) narrated regarding the time of 'Asr prayer: "While the sun is high." [Reported by Muslim in another narration of the former Hadith].

2101860.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2101860
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 004
2101860.text: Narrated Abu Barza al-Aslami (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) used to offer the 'Asr prayer (and after the prayer) one of us would return to his house at the furthest end of al-Madinah and arrive while the sun was still hot and bright. And he (ﷺ) loved to delay the 'Isha' prayer, and he disliked sleeping before it and conversation after it. After the Fajr prayer he used to leave when a man could recognize the one sitting beside him and he used to recite between 60 to 100 Verse of Qur'an in the Fajr prayer. [Agreed upon].

2101870.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2101870
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 005
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 005
2101870.text: Narrated Jabir (RA), in the version of al-BUkhari and Muslim: [The Prophet (ﷺ)] used to advance the 'Isha' prayer sometimes and delay it at other times. Whenever he saw the people assembled (for the 'Isha' prayer) he would pray early and if the people delayed, he would delay the prayer. And the Prophet (ﷺ) used to offer the Fajr prayer when it was still dark.

2101880.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2101880
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 006
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 006
2101880.text: Narrated Abu Musa (RA) in another version of Muslim: He (ﷺ) offered the Fajr prayer at daybreak when the people could hardly recognize one another.

2101890.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2101890
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 007
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 007
2101890.text: Narrated Rafi' bin Khadij (RA): We used to offer the Maghrib prayer with Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and then one of us would go (out of the mosque) and be able to see the spot his would fall at. [Agreed upon].

2101900.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2101900
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 008
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 008
2101900.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) delayed (the 'Isha' prayer) one night till a great part of the night passed, then he went out and offered the prayer, and said, "This is the proper time for it; were it not that I would impose a burden on my followers." [Reported by Muslim].

2101910.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2101910
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 009
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 009
2101910.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "When it is hot, delay the (Zuhr) prayer till it cools down, for the intensity of heat is from the exhalation of Hell." [Agreed upon].

2101920.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2101920
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 010
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 010
2101920.text: Narrated Rafi' bin Khadij (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Offer the morning prayer at dawn, for it is greater for your rewards." [Reported by al-Khamsah. at-Tirmidhi and Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2101930.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2101930
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 011
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 011
2101930.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "He who prays a Rak'a of the Fajr prayer before the sun rises, has offered the dawn prayer in its time, and he who prays a Rak'a of the 'Asr prayer before the sun sets has offered the afternoon prayer." [Agreed upon].

2101940.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2101940
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 012
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 012
2101940.text: Muslim reported the same above Hadith in another version narrated by 'Aishah (RA), who narrated 'Sajdah (prostration)' instead of 'Rak'a (prayer unit)' and then he (Muslim) said: "A Sajdah implies a Rak'a."

2101950.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2101950
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 013
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 013
2101950.text: Narrated Abu Sa'id al-Khudri (RA): I heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) saying: "No Salat (prayer) is to be offered after the morning prayer until the sun rises, or after the afternoon prayer until the sun sets." [Agreed upon].

2101960.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2101960
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 014
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 014
2101960.text: And in the narration of Muslim: "There is no Salat (prayer) after the Fajr (morning) prayer."

2101970.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2101970
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 015
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 015
2101970.text: 'Uqbah bin 'Aamir (RA) narrated: "There are three times at which Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) used to forbid us to pray or bury our dead: (a) when the sun begins to rise till it is fully up, (b) when the sun is at its height at midday till it passes the meridian, and (c) when the sun draws near to setting till it sets." [Reported by Muslim].

2101980.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2101980
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 016
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 016
2101980.text: ash-Shafi'i views the second ruling from

2101990.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2101990
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 017
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 017
2101990.text: A Hadith narrated by Abu Hurairah (RA) through a weak Sanad with the addition: "Except on Friday".

2102000.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102000
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 018
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 018
2102000.text: Abu Dawud reported something similar from Abu Qatadah (RA).

2102010.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102010
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 019
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 019
2102010.text: Narrated Jubair bin Mut'im (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "O descendants of 'Abd Manaf! You must not prevent anyone who goes round this House (Ka'bah) and prays (here) at any hour of the night or day that he wishes." [Reported by al-Khamsah, at-Tirmidhi and Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2102020.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102020
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 020
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 020
2102020.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "The twilight is the redness." [Reported by ad-Daraqutni. Ibn Khuzaimah graded it Sahih (authentic) and others graded it Mawquf (a saying of a Companion)].

2102030.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102030
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 021
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 021
2102030.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that, "Dawn is of two types; the dawn in which eating is forbidden (for the fasting person) and prayer is permitted and the dawn in which prayer is forbidden i.e. the morning prayer and eating is permitted." [Reported by Ibn Khuzaimah and al-Hakim who (both) graded it Sahih].

2102040.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102040
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 022
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 022
2102040.text: al-Hakim reported something similar to the above Hadith from Jabir and added to the type of dawn in which eating is forbidden: "it is spread widely in the horizon," and to the other type: "it has the shape of wolf's tail."

2102050.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102050
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 023
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 023
2102050.text: Narrated Ibn Mas'ud (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "One of the best deeds is to offer Salat (prayer) in its early time." [Reported by at-Tirmidhi and al-Hakim who (both) graded it Sahih].

2102060.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102060
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 024
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 024
2102060.text: Its basic meaning is in the Sahihain of al-Bukhari and Muslim.

2102070.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102070
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 025
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 025
2102070.text: Narrated Abu Mahdhurah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "The earliest time of prayer is what pleases Allah, the midtime is for the mercy of Allah and the latest time is what Allah pardons." [Reported by ad-Daraqutni with a very weak Sanad (chain)].

2102080.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102080
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 026
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 026
2102080.text: at-Tirmidhi has reported something similar, narrated by Ibn 'Umar, without mentioning the midtime. [It is Da'if (weak) too].

2102090.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102090
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 027
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 027
2102090.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "There is no Salat (i.e. voluntary prayer) after the break of dawn except Sajdatain (Sunnah of Fajr)." [Reported by al-Khamsah except an-Nasa'i].

2102100.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102100
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 028
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 028
2102100.text: In another narration : 'Abdur-Razzaq also narrated: "There is no Salat (voluntary prayer) after the break of dawn ecept the two (Sunnah) Rak'a of Fajr."

2102110.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102110
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 029
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 029
2102110.text: A narration of ad-Daraqutni narrated by Amr bin al-'Aas is similar to the one above.

2102120.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102120
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 030
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 030
2102120.text: Narrated Umm Salamah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) came to my house after offering 'Asr prayer and offered two Rak'a, then I asked him about that and he replied, "I was kept busy (and failed to pray) the two (Sunnah) Rak'a after Zuhr prayer, so I offered them now." I asked him, "Should we offer them if we miss them?" He (ﷺ) replied, "No." [Reported by Ahmad].

2102130.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102130
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 031
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 031
2102130.text: The narration of Abu Dawud from 'Aishah (RA) has the same meaning.

2102140.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102140
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 032
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 032
2102140.text: Narrated 'Abdullah bin Zaid bin Abd-Rabbihi (RA): A man appeared to me while I was asleep and told me to say, "Allahu Akbar, Allahu Akbar (Allah is the Most Great, Allah is the Most Great)" and he mentioned the Adhan with Allahu Akbar four times without Tarji', and the Iqama once except Qad qamat-is-Salah (the prayer stood ready to begin), (he repeated it twice). He ('Abdullah) said when it was morning I went to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and he said, "It is a true vision..." [Reported by Ahmad and Abu Dawud; at-Tirmidni and Ibn Khuzaimah graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2102150.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102150
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 033
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 033
2102150.text: Ahmad added to the end of the above Hadith, the story of BIlal's statement in the Fajr Adhan (morning prayer call): as-Salatu khairun minan-nawm - "Prayer is better than sleep".

2102160.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102160
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 034
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 034
2102160.text: Ibn Khuzaimah reported from Anas (RA): "It is from the Sunnah that when the Mu'adhadhin says [in the first Adhan of] Fajr (prayer time): 'Haiya 'alal-Falah (Come to the success)', he says (also) 'as-Salatu khairun minan-nawm (Prayer is better than sleep).'"

2102170.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102170
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 035
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 035
2102170.text: Narrated Abu Mahdhura (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) taught him the Adhan (call to prayer) and he (the narrator) mentioned the Tarji' in it. [Muslim reported it, but mentioned the phrase (Takbir) "Allah is the Most Great" at its beginning just twice.

2102180.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102180
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 036
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 036
2102180.text: al-Khamsah reported it, but mentioned the Takbir four times.

2102190.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102190
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 037
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 037
2102190.text: Narrated Anas (RA): Bilal was commanded to announce the Adhan (each phrase) twice and the Iqamah (each phrase) once except "The prayer stood ready to begin" (to be pronounced twice). [Agreed upon; but Muslim did not mentioned the exception].

2102200.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102200
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 038
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 038
2102200.text: A narration of an-Nasa'i has: "Bilal was ordered by the Prophet (ﷺ)."

2102210.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102210
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 039
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 039
2102210.text: Narrated Abu Juhaifa (RA): I saw Bilal calling for prayer and I would follow (looking at) his mouth (as he turned it) this (right) side and that (left) side with his fingers in his ears. [Reported by Ahmad and at-Tirmidhi who graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2102220.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102220
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 040
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 040
2102220.text: In a narration of Ibn Majah - 'and he put his fingers in his ears'.

2102230.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102230
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 041
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 041
2102230.text: And also a narration of Abu Dawud - 'he turned his neck to the right and left when he reached Haiya 'alas-Salah (Come to the prayer) and did not turn his body'.

2102240.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102240
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 042
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 042
2102240.text: And its basic meaning is in Sahihain (al-Bukhari and Muslim).

2102250.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102250
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 043
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 043
2102250.text: Narrated Abu Mandhura (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) liked his voice, so he taught him the Adhan (call to prayer). [Reported by Ibn Khuzaimah].

2102260.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102260
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 044
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 044
2102260.text: Narrated Jabir bin Samurah (RA): I prayed with the Prophet (ﷺ) the two 'Eids, not only once or twice, without an Adhan or an Iqamah. [Reported by Muslim].

2102270.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102270
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 045
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 045
2102270.text: A similar narration is in al-Bukhari and Muslim narrated by 'Abdullah bin 'Abbas (RA) and others.

2102280.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102280
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 046
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 046
2102280.text: Narrated Abu Qatadah (RA) in a long Hadith about their (Sahaba) sleeping late past the time of Salat (prayer): Then Bilal proclaimed the Adhan and the Prophet (ﷺ) offered the prayer (while leading the Companions) as he used to do every day. [Reported by Muslim].

2102290.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102290
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 047
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 047
2102290.text: Muslim also reported from Jabir (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) came to al-Muzdalifah and offered at it both the Maghrib and 'Isha prayers with one Adhan and two Iqamah.

2102300.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102300
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 048
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 048
2102300.text: Muslim also reported from Ibn 'Umar (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) combined the Maghrib and 'Isha prayers with one Iqamah.

2102310.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102310
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 049
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 049
2102310.text: Abu Dawud added the words: "for each prayer".

2102320.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102320
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 050
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 050
2102320.text: And in another narration he reported: The Adhan was not announced for any one of them.

2102330.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102330
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 051
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 051
2102330.text:
Narrated Ibn 'Umar and 'Aishah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Bilal calls for prayer when it is still night, so eat and drink till Ibn Umm Maktum calls for prayer." And he (Ibn Umm Maktum) was a blind man who did not call for a prayer until he was told: "It is morning time, it is morning time." [Agreed upon].
There is an Idraj in its last part.

2102350.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102350
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 052
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 052
2102350.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): Bilal called for prayer before dawn and the Prophet (ﷺ) told him to return and announce: "Lo! the slave of Allah (i.e. Bilal) had slept (hence this mistake)". [Reported by Abu Dawud, and graded as Da'if (weak)].

2102360.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102360
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 053
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 053
2102360.text: Narrated Abu Sa'id al-Khudri (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "When you hear the Adhan repeat what the Mu'adhdhin (the call-maker) says." [Agreed upon].

2102370.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102370
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 054
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 054
2102370.text: And al-Bukhari has reported similarly in a narration by Mu'awiyah (RA).

2102380.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102380
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 055
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 055
2102380.text: And Muslim reported a narration by 'Umar (RA) regarding the virtue of repeating what the Mu'adhdhin pronounces word by word except when the Mu'adhdhin says: "Haiya 'alas-Salah, Haiya 'alal-Falah (Come to the prayer and come to the success)", one should say: "La hawla wa la quwwata illa billah [there is no might and no power except with (the help of) Allah]."

2102390.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102390
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 056
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 056
2102390.text: Narrated 'Uthman bin Abul-'Aas (RA): He said, "O Messenger of Allah, appointment as the Imam (leader) of my people (in prayers). He (ﷺ) said: "You are their Imam, but you should follow (observe the strength of) the weakest among them and appoint a Mu'adhdhin who does not charge for the call of Adhan." [Reported by al-Khamsah, at-Tirmidhi graded it Hasan (good) and al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2102400.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102400
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 057
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 057
2102400.text: Narrated Malik bin al-Huwairith (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said to us, "When the time of Salat (prayer) comes, one of you should announce the Adhan." [Reported by as-Sab'ah].

2102410.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102410
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 058
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 058
2102410.text: Narrated Jabir (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said to Bilal, "When you announce the Adhan, utter deliberately and when you pronounce the Iqamah utter quickly, and leave between your Adhan and your Iqamah time for one who is eating to finish his food." [Reported by at-Tirmidhi who graded it Da'if (weak)].

2102420.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102420
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 059
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 059
2102420.text:
He also reported from Abu Hurairah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "No one should announce Adhan except the one who has performed the ablution". [Reported by at-Tirmidhi who graded it Da'if (weak)].
So the narration is weak whether Marfu' [reaching back to the Prophet (ﷺ)] or Mawquf (saying of a Companion).

2102440.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102440
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 060
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 060
2102440.text: He also reported from Ziyad bin al-Harith (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The one who announces the Adhan should also pronounce the Iqamah." [Reported by at-Tirmidhi who graded it Da'if (weak)].

2102450.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102450
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 061
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 061
2102450.text: Narrated 'Abdullah bin Zaid in another narration of the Hadith reported by Abu Dawud: I saw it, i.e. the Adhan (in a vision) and I wanted to announce it. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "You pronounce the Iqamah." [This Hadith is also Da'if (weak)].

2102460.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102460
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 062
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 062
2102460.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The Mu'adhdhin has more right to [determine the time to] announce the Adhan and the Imam has more right to [determine when to] pronounce the Iqamah." [Reported by Ibn 'Adi who graded it Da'if (weak)].

2102470.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102470
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 063
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 063
2102470.text: al-Baihaqi has reported a similar narration from the saying of 'Ali (RA).

2102480.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102480
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 064
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 064
2102480.text: Narrated Anas bin Malik (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "A supplication made between the Adhan and Iqamah is not rejected." [Reported by an-Nasa'i and Ibn Khuzaimah graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2102490.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102490
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 065
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 065
2102490.text: Narrated Jabir (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "If anyone says when he hears the Adhan: 'O Allah! Lord of this perfect call and of the regular prayer which is going to be established! Kindly give Muhammad (ﷺ) the right of intercession and superiority, and send him (on the Day of Judgement) to the best and highest place in Paradise which You promised him', he will be assured of my intercession on the Day of Judgement." [Reported by al-Arba'ah].

2102500.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102500
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 066
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 066
2102500.text: Narrated 'Ali bin Talq (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "When one of you releases air (through his anus) during Salat (prayer), he should break the Salat (prayer) then perform ablution and repeat the prayer." [Reported by al-Khamsah and Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2102510.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102510
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 067
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 067
2102510.text: Narrated 'Aisha (ra): Allah’s Messenger (ﷺ) said: “Whoever vomits, bleeds through the nose, or released Madhi (urethral discharge) should go, perform ablution and then complete his Salat (prayer) (by continuing from where he had stopped at) on condition that he does not speak in the process”. Reported by Ibn Majah and it was graded weak by Ahmed.

2102520.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102520
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 068
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 068
2102520.text: Narrated ['Aishah (RA)]: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "The Salat (prayer) of a woman, who has reached puberty, is not accepted unless she is wearing a Khimar." [Reported by al-Khamsah except an-Naza'i. And Ibn Khuzaimah graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2102530.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102530
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 069
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 069
2102530.text: Narrated Jabir (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "If the garment is ample, wrap it round your body i.e. during the Salat (prayer)." A narration by Muslim has: "you should cross the two ends, and if it is tight, you should wrap it round your waist." [Agreed upon].

2102540.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102540
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 070
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 070
2102540.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): [The Prophet (ﷺ) said:] None of you should offer Salat (prayer) in a single garment with no part of it on his shoulders. [Agreed upon].

2102550.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102550
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 071
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 071
2102550.text: Narrated Umm Salamah (RA): She asked the Prophet (ﷺ), "Can a woman pray in a long dress and a veil without wearing a lower garment?" He replied, "If the long dress is ample and covers the surface of her feet." [Reported by Abu Dawud and the Imams graded it Mawquf (a saying of Umm Salamah)].

2102560.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102560
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 072
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 072
2102560.text: Narrated 'Aamir bin Rabi'ah (RA): We were with the Prophet (ﷺ) during a dark night and we became uncertain about the Qiblah (the direction of Makkah) we then prayed (without being certain). When the run rose, we discovered that we prayed towards a direction other than the Qiblah. So this Verse was revealed: "...so wherever you turn yourselves or your faces, there is the Face of Allah..." [Reported by at-Tirmidhi who graded it Da'if (weak)].

2102570.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102570
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 073
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 073
2102570.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The direction between the east and west is Qiblah." [Reported by at-Tirmidhi, and al-Bukhari considered it Qawi (strong)].

2102580.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102580
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 074
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 074
2102580.text: Narrated 'Aamir bin Rabi'ah (RA): I saw Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) praying while mounted on his riding animal facing whatever direction it faced. [Agreed upon].

2102590.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102590
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 075
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 075
2102590.text: al-Bukhari added: "Making gestures with his head and he did not do that (pray while mounted) with obligatory prayers."

2102600.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102600
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 076
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 076
2102600.text: Narrated Anas in another narration of the Hadith reported by Abu Dawud: When [he (ﷺ)] traveled, and intended to pray a voluntary prayer, he used to direct his riding camel towards the Qiblah, say, "Allahu Akbar" and pray facing whatever direction it faced. [Its chain is Hasan (good)].

2102610.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102610
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 077
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 077
2102610.text: Narrated Abu Sa'id al-Khudri (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "The whole earth is a mosque (to pray on) except a graveyard and a toilet." [Reported by at-Tirmidhi and it has an 'Illa (a defect)].

2102620.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102620
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 078
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 078
2102620.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade prayer at seven places; a dump, a slaughter house, a graveyard, the middle of the path, a bathroom, and where camels sit at a watering place and on (roof) of the Ka'bah. [Reported by at-Tirmidhi who graded it Da'if (weak)].

2102630.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102630
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 079
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 079
2102630.text: Narrated Abu Marthad al-Ghanawi (RA): I heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) say, "Don't pray towards graves and don't sit on them." [Reported by Muslim]

2102640.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102640
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 080
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 080
2102640.text: Narrated Abu Sa'id (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "When any of you comes to the mosque he should look and if he sees impurity on his sandals (shoes) he should wipe them and then pray in them." [Reported by Abu Dawud, and Ibn Khuzaimah graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2102650.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102650
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 081
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 081
2102650.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "If one of you steps on filth with his two leather socks then the earth is their purification." [Reported by Abu Dawud, and Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2102660.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102660
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 082
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 082
2102660.text: Narrated Mu'awiya bin al-Hakam (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Talking is not befitting during the Salat (prayer), for it (prayer) consists only of glorifying Allah, declaring His Greatness and the recitation of the Qur'an." [Reported by Muslim].

2102670.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102670
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 083
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 083
2102670.text: Narrated Zaid bin Arqam (RA): We used to talk while engaged in Salat (prayer) during the lifetime of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and one would talk with his companion regarding his needs in prayer till (this verse) was revealed: "Guard strictly the prayers, especially the middle prayer; and stand before Allah with obedience," then we were commanded to observe silence (in prayer) and were forbidden to talk. [Agreed upon. This wording is from Muslim].

2102680.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102680
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 084
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 084
2102680.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Glorification of Allah (i.e. saying) is for men and clapping of hands is for women." [Agreed upon].

2102690.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102690
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 085
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 085

2102700.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102700
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 086
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 086
2102700.text: Narrated Mutarrif bin Abdullah bin Shikhkhir (RA) from his father, who said, "I saw Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) when he was engaged in prayer, and heard a sound from his chest, like the bubbling of a pot, from weeping." [Reported by al-Khamsah except Ibn Majah, and Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2102720.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102720
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 087
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 087
2102720.text: Narrated Ali (RA): "I had the permission of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) to see him in his house at two times, and whenever I entered to him while he was praying he would clear his throat as a sign to me." [Reported by an-Nasa'i and Ibn Majah].

2102730.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102730
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 088
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 088
2102730.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): I asked Bilal (RA), "How did you observe the Prophet (ﷺ) replying to their (the Companions) salutation while he was engaged in prayer?" He (Bilal) said: "He used to do this way," and he (Bilal) demonstrated by spreading his palm. [Reported by Abu Dawud and at-Tirmidhi. The latter graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2102740.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102740
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 089
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 089
2102740.text: Narrated Abu Qatada (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was (one time) offering prayer while he was carrying Umama, daughter of Zainab, when he prostrated he put her down and when he stood up he lifted her up. [Agreed upon].

2102750.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102750
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 090
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 090
2102750.text: Muslim has: "While he (ﷺ) led the people in the prayer in the masjid..."

2102760.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102760
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 091
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 091
2102760.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): "Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Kill the two black ones during Salat (prayer), the snake and the scorpion." [Reported by al-Arba'a, and Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2102770.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102770
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 092
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 092
2102770.text: Narrated Abu Juhaim bin al-Harith (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "If the person who passes in front of another person in prayer knew the magnitude of his sin, it would have been better for him to wait for forty than pass in front of him." [Agreed upon. This wording is from al-Bukhari].

2102780.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102780
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 093
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 093
2102780.text: It is mentioned in al-Bazzar through another chain with the addition: "forty years."

2102790.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102790
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 094
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 094
2102790.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was asked in the expedition of Tabuk about the Sutra of the person who is offering the prayer; he said , "It is (something) like the back of a saddle." [Reported by Muslim].

2102800.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102800
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 095
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 095
2102800.text: Narrated Sabra bin Ma'bad al-Juhani (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Let one of you who is in Salat (prayer) put a Sutra in front of him even if it is an arrow." [Reported by al-Hakim].

2102810.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102810
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 096
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 096
2102810.text: Narrated Abu Dhar al-Ghifari (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ), "In case there is not before him (an object) like the back of a saddle, a Muslim's Salat (prayer) would be cut off by (the passing of) a woman, a donkey and a black dog." And it concludes: "the black dog is a devil." [Reported by Muslim].

2102820.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102820
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 097
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 097
2102820.text: Muslim also reported through Abu Hurairah (RA) a similar Hadith without the mention of Kalb (dog).

2102830.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102830
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 098
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 098
2102830.text: In another narration Abu Dawud and an-Nasa'i reported through Ibn Abbas (RA) a similar report without its end and connected the prohibition of a woman passing in front of a praying person to the state of being in her menstruation period.

2102840.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102840
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 099
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 099
2102840.text: Narrated Abu Sa'id al-Khudri (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "If one of you prays towards an object separating him from the people and someone tries to pass (between him and the object) in front of him, let him turn him away but if he refuses he should fight him for he is a devil." [Agreed upon].

2102850.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102850
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 100
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 100
2102850.text: In another narration: "for there is a Satan with him."

2102860.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102860
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 101
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 101
2102860.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "When one of you prays, he should put something in front of him, and if he cannot find something he should set up a stick; but if he has no stick with him he should draw a line, then what passes in front of him will not harm him." [Reported by Ahmad and Ibn Majah. And Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic). And he who claims it is Mudtarib (inconclusive) is not correct. Rather is Hasan (good)].

2102870.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102870
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 102
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 102
2102870.text: Narrated Abu Sa'id al-Khudri (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Nothing interrupts Salat (prayer), but avert as much as you can (things that cut off prayer)." [Reported by Abu Dawud and there is weakness in its chain].

2102880.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102880
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 103
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 103
2102880.text:
Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade keeping one's hands on one's waist while praying. [Agreed upon]. The wording is that of Muslim's.
And it's meaning is to put (one's) hands on his waist.

2102900.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102900
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 104
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 104
2102900.text: And in the narration of al-Bukhari narrated by 'Aishah (RA) is: "This is a practice of the Jews."

2102910.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102910
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 105
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 105
2102910.text: Narrated Anas (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "If supper is brought (and the prayer is ready) start with it (the food) before you pray the Maghrib (prayer)." [Agreed upon].

2102920.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102920
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 106
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 106
2102920.text: Narrated Abu Dhar (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "When one of you is praying he must not remove pebbles (from his face) for the mercy is facing him." [Reported by al-Khamsah with a Sahih (authentic) chain].

2102930.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102930
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 107
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 107
2102930.text: And Ahmad added to the above Hadith: "(remove the pebbles) once or leave (them)."

2102940.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102940
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 108
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 108
2102940.text: It is also reported in as-Sahih on the authority of Mu'aiqib without mention of the reason.

2102950.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102950
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 109
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 109
2102950.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): I asked Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) about looking around during prayer and he said, "It is something which the devil snatches from a person's prayer." [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2102960.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102960
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 110
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 110
2102960.text: at-Tirmidhi has reported and graded as Sahih (authentic) the narration of Anas (RA): "Avoid looking around when you are engaged in prayer, for looking around is destruction. And if you must do it, do so in the voluntary prayers."

2102970.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102970
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 111
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 111
2102970.text: Narrated Anas (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "When anyone of you is engaged in Salat (prayer), he is holding intimate conversation with his Rabb so he should not spit in front of him, nor to his right side, but to his left side, under his foot". [Agreed upon].

2102980.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102980
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 112
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 112
2102980.text: A narration has: "or under his foot."

2102990.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2102990
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 113
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 113
2102990.text: Narrated [Anas (RA)]: 'Aishah (RA) had a Qiram (a soft piece of cloth with colours) with which she had screened one side of her house. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Take away this Qiram of yours, for its pictures are displayed in front of me during my prayer." [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2103000.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103000
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 114
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 114
2103000.text: al-Bukhari and Muslim have also reported a Hadith narrated by her ['Aishah (RA)] in which is mentioned the story of Abu Jahm's Ambijania (a plain woolem garment) with the addition: "it (the Khamisa) has distracted me from my prayer."

2103010.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103010
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 115
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 115
2103010.text: Narrated Jabir bin Samura (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Those people who raise their eyes to heaven while in Salat (prayer) should stop (doing so) or else their sight will not return to them." [Reported by Muslim].

2103020.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103020
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 116
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 116
2103020.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA) in another narration of it from Muslim: I heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "No Salat (prayer) can be (rightly offered) with food brought (before the worshiper) or when he is resisting the urge to relive himself of the two filths (i.e. urine and feces)."

2103030.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103030
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 117
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 117
2103030.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Yawning is caused by the devil, so when one of you yawns he must repress it as much as he can." [Reported by Muslim].

2103040.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103040
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 118
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 118
2103040.text: Also reported by at-Tirmidhi, and he added: "during Salat (prayers)."

2103050.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103050
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 119
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 119
2103050.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) ordered that the mosques be built in residential districts and that it be cleaned and perfumed. [Reported by Ahmad, Abu Dawud, and at-Tirmidhi. The latter considered it Mursal [missing link in the chain after the Tabi'i (student of a Companion)].

2103060.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103060
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 120
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 120
2103060.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "May Allah curse the Jews! They have turned the graves of their Prophets into mosques." [Agreed upon].

2103070.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103070
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 121
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 121

2103080.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103080
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 122
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 122
2103080.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA) in al-Bukhari and Muslim [that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said], "When a pious person amongst them (the Jews and Christians) died they used to build a place of worship and prostration on his grave." In the same Hadith is: "Those are the worst of creatures."

2103090.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103090
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 123
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 123
2103090.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) sent an expedition of horsemen who came back with a man, they then tied him to one of the pillars of the mosque. [Agreed upon].

2103100.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103100
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 124
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 124
2103100.text: Narrated [Abu Hurairah (RA)]: Umar came over Hassan while reciting poetry inside the mosque and looked at him sternly, then he (Hassan) said: "I used to recite poetry inside it (the mosque) in the presence of one who is more pious than you [i.e. the Prophet (ﷺ)]". [Agreed upon].

2103110.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103110
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 125
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 125
2103110.text: Narrated [Abu Hurairah (RA)]: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Whoever hears a man crying out in the mosque about something he has lost, he should say, 'May Allah not restore it to you', for the mosques were not built for this." [Reported by Muslim].

2103120.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103120
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 126
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 126
2103120.text: Narrated [Abu Hurairah (RA)]: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "If you see someone buying or selling inside the mosque, say: 'May Allah not make your trading profitable!'" [Reported by an-Nasa'i and at-Tirmidhi and the latter graded it Hasan (good)].

2103130.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103130
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 127
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 127
2103130.text: Narrated Hakim bin Hizam (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Neither the prescribed punishment nor retaliations should be executed inside the mosque." [Reported by Ahmad and Abu Dawud through a weak Sanad (chain)].

2103140.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103140
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 128
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 128
2103140.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): On the day of al-Khandaq (battle of the Trench), Sa'd was injured and Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) pitched a tent for him in the mosque to visit him from a close distance. [Agreed upon].

2103150.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103150
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 129
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 129
2103150.text: Narrated ['Aishah (RA)]: I saw Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) at the door of my house screening me while I watched some Abyssinians (Ethiopians) who were playing in the mosque... (the narration). [Agreed upon].

2103160.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103160
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 130
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 130
2103160.text: Narrated ['Aishah (RA)]: One black slave-girl had a tent in the mosque and she used to come to me and talk (with me) in my house. [Agreed upon].

2103170.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103170
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 131
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 131
2103170.text: Narrated Anas (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Spitting in the mosque is a sin and its expiation is burying it." [Agreed upon].

2103180.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103180
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 132
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 132
2103180.text: Narrated [Anas (RA)]: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The House (Judgement Day) will not come until people boast (to each other) with (the construction and decoration of) mosques. [Reported by al-Khamsah except at-Tirmidhi, and Ibn Khuzaimah graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2103190.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103190
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 133
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 133
2103190.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "I was not commanded to build beautified mosques". [Reported by Abu Dawud and Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic)]

2103200.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103200
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 134
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 134
2103200.text: Narrated Anas (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The rewards of my Ummah (followers) were shown to me, even a peck of dust a man takes out of the mosque." [Reported by Abu Dawud and at-Tirmidhi. The latter graded it Gharib (having a single narrator), and Ibn Khuzaimah graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2103210.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103210
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 135
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 135
2103210.text: Narrated Abu Qatada (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "When one of you enters a mosque, he must not sit until he prays two Rak'ah." [Agreed upon].

2103220.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103220
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 136
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 136
2103220.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "When you get up to pray, perform ablution perfectly, then face the Qiblah and say: 'Allahu Akbar' (Allah is the Most Great). Then recite a convenient portion of the Qur'an; then bow and remain calmly in that position for a moment, then rise up and stand erect; then prostrate and remain calmly in that position for a moment, then rise up and sit calmly, then prostrate and remain calmly in that position for a moment; then do that throughout your prayer." [Reported by as-Sab'a and the wording is that of al-Bukhari].

2103230.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103230
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 137
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 137
2103230.text: The narration of Ibn Majah through a chain of Muslim has: "Then rise up and stand erect calmly."

2103240.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103240
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 138
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 138
2103240.text: And in the narration of Ibn Hibban and Ahmad the Hadith of Rifa'a bin Rafi' bin Malik is similar to the above.

2103250.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103250
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 139
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 139
2103250.text: And Ahmad has: "Keep your back straight till the bones return (to their positions)."

2103260.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103260
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 140
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 140
2103260.text: And in the narration of an-Nasa'i and Abu Dawud from the Hadith of Rifa'a bin Rafi': "The Salat (prayer) of one of you will not be complete until he performs Wudu' (ablution) properly as Allah commanded him, then he says Allahu Akbar and Alhamdu lillah and praises Him."

2103270.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103270
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 141
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 141
2103270.text: It is also mentionmed in the same Hadith, "If you know any portion of the Qur'an, read it or else say: Alhamdu lillah, Allahu Akbar and La ilaha ill-Allah."

2103280.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103280
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 142
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 142
2103280.text: And Abu Dawud has "Then read the Ummul-Qur'an (i.e. Surah al-Fatiha) and what ever Allah wishes".

2103290.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103290
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 143
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 143
2103290.text: Ibn Hibban also has: "and then (read) whatever you wish."

2103300.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103300
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 144
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 144
2103300.text: Narrated Abu Humaid As-Sa'idi (RA): "I saw Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) when he uttered the Takbir, he placed his hands parallel to his shoulders; and when he bowed down, he rested his hands on his knees, then bent his back. When he raised his head up, he stood erect until the bones of his spine became straight. When he prostrated, he placed his arms such that they were neither spread out nor drawn in, and the tips of his toes were facing the Qiblah; when he sat up, at the end of two Rak'a, he sat on his left foot and put erect the right one; and when he sat up after the last Rak'a he put forward the left foot, put erect the other one and sat on his buttock." [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2103310.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103310
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 145
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 145
2103310.text: Narrated 'Ali bin Abi Talib (RA): Whenever Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) stood for Salat (prayer), he used to say: "I have turned my face (as a monotheist) towards Him who created the heavens and the earth and I am not from the polytheists. My prayer and my devotion, my life and my death belong to Allah, the Lord of the universe, Who has no partner. That is what I have been commanded, and I am a Muslim. O Allah, You are the King. There is nothing which deserves to be worshipped but You. You are my Rabb (Lord) and I am Your slave. I have wronged myself, but I acknowledge my sin, so forgive me all my sins, You alone can forgive sins; and guide me to the best qualities, You alone can guide to the best of them: and turn me from evil ones, You alone can turn from evil qualities. I come to serve and please You. All good is in Your Hands and evil does not pertain to You. I seek refuge in You and turn to You, You are the Blessed and the Exalted. I ask Your forgiveness and turn to You in repentance." [Reported by Muslim].

2103320.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103320
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 146
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 146
2103320.text: And in another narration of Muslim: "he used to say that in the night prayer..."

2103330.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103330
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 147
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 147
2103330.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA) Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) used to keep silent - between the opening Takbir of the prayer and the recitation of the Qur'an - for a short while. Then, I asked him (about that) and he replied, "I say, 'O Allah! Keep me apart from my sins (faults) as you have kept apart the east and west. O Allah clean me from my sins as a white garment is cleaned from dirt. O Allah wash me of my sins with water, snow and hail." [Agreed upon].

2103340.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103340
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 148
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 148
2103340.text: Narrated 'Umar (RA): He (ﷺ) used to say, "How perfect You are O Allah, and Praise is for You, Blessed is Your Name and Exalted is Your Majesty and there is nothing which deserves to be worshipped besides You." [Reported by Muslim with a Munqati' (broken) chain. And in the version of ad-Daraqutni, it is Mawsul (unbroken chain), and it is Mawquf (saying of a companion ('Umar)].

2103350.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103350
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 149
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 149
2103350.text: Abu Sa'id al-Khudri (RA) narrated a similar report Marfu' [reaching back to the Prophet (ﷺ)] collected by al-Khamsah.

2103360.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103360
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 150
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 150
2103360.text: Containing the words: He (ﷺ) used to say after the (opening) Takbir (for prayer), "I seek refuge in Allah, the All-Hearing and the All-Knowing from the accursed devil, from his madness or evil suggestion (Hamz), from his puffing up (Nafkh), and from his witchcraft (Nafth)."

2103370.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103370
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 151
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 151
2103370.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA) Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) used to begin the Salat (prayer) with Takbir (Allahu Akbar - Allah is the Most Great) and the recitation with Alhamdu lillahi Rabbil' alamin (praise is to Allah, the Rabb of the universe)." And when he bowed down, he neither kept his head up nor bent it down, but kept it between that (two positions). When he raised his head from the bowing position, he did not prostrate till he had stood erect; and when he raised his head after a prostration, he did not prostrate again till he had sat up. And at the end of every two Rak'ah he said the Tahiyyah, and he used to sit on his left foot and position he right one vertically, and he prohibited the devil's way of sitting on the buttocks. He forbade people to spread out their arms like a wild beast. And he used to finish the prayer with the Taslim (i.e. saying As-Salamu 'alaikum). [Reported by Muslim and it has an 'illa (defect)].

2103380.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103380
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 152
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 152
2103380.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) used to raise his hands parallel to his shoulders when he started the prayer (by saying Allahu Akbar), when he uttered the Takbir to bow and when he raised his head from the Ruku' (bowing posture). [Agreed upon].

2103390.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103390
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 153
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 153
2103390.text: Abu Dawud reported a Hadith narrated by Abu Humaid (RA) to the effect that he [Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)] used to raise his hands and bring them parallel to his shoulders, and then utter the Takbir.

2103400.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103400
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 154
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 154
2103400.text: Muslim has a Hadith narrated by Malik bin Huwairith (ﷺ) similar to the Hadith narrated by Ibn 'Umar (RA). But he (Malik bin Huwairith) mentioned: "He [the Prophet (ﷺ)] raised his hands parallel to the end of his ears."

2103410.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103410
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 155
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 155
2103410.text: Narrated Wa'il bin Hujr (RA): I prayed with the Prophet (ﷺ) and he put his right hand on his left (and then placed them) on his chest. [Reported by Ibn Khuzaimah].

2103420.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103420
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 156
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 156
2103420.text: Narrated 'Ubada bin As-Samit (ﷺ): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "There is no Salat (prayer) for him who does not recite Ummul-Qur'an (Surat al-Fatiha)". (Agreed upon].

2103430.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103430
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 157
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 157
2103430.text: In the narration of Ibn Hibban and ad-Daraqutni is mentioned: "The Salat (prayer) is not complete if one does not recite (Surat) Fatiha al-Kitab."

2103440.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103440
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 158
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 158
2103440.text: And in another narration of Ahmad, Abu Dawud, at-Tirmidhi, and Ibn Hibban is: "Perhaps you recite behind your Imam?" We replied, "Yes." He [the Prophet (ﷺ)] said, "Do not do so except when it is (Surat) Fatiha al-Kitab, for the Salat (prayer) of the one who does not recite it, is not accepted."

2103450.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103450
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 159
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 159
2103450.text: Narrated Anas (RA): "The Prophet (ﷺ), Abu Bakr and 'Umar used to begin the Salat (prayer) with Al-hamdu lillahi Rabbil-'alamin." [Agreed upon].

2103460.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103460
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 160
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 160
2103460.text: And Muslim added: "They would not recite Bismillahir-Rahmanir-Rahim, neither in the beginning of the recitation nor at the end of it."

2103470.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103470
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 161
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 161
2103470.text: In another narration from Ahmad, an-Nasa'i and Ibn Khuzaimah: "They never used to recite Bismillahir-Rahmanir-Rahim aloud."

2103480.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103480
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 162
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 162
2103480.text: And in another report from Ibn Khuzaimah: "They used to recite Bismillahir-Rahmanir-Rahim silently."

2103490.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103490
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 163
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 163
2103490.text: The negation (of recitation of the Bismillah) in the report of Muslim can be understood in light of this report (i.e. it was recited silently), as opposed to those who declared Muslim's report as being defective.

2103500.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103500
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 164
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 164
2103500.text: Narrated Nu'aim Mujmir (RA): "I prayed behind Abu Hurairah (RA) and he recited Bismillahir-Rahmanir-Rahim, and then recited Umm-ul-Qur'an (Al-Fatiha) and when he reached walad-dallin, he said Amin; and then said Allahu Akbar, when he prostrated and when he stood up from his sitting position. And when he uttered the Taslim (i.e. As-Salamu 'Alaikum), he said, "I swear by the One (i.e. Allah) in Whose Hand my soul is, my Salat (prayer) resembles most that of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) than that of anyone among you." [Reported by an-Nasa'i and lbn Khuzaimah].

2103510.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103510
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 165
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 165
2103510.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Whenever you recite Surat Al-Fatiha, recite Bismillahir-Rahmanir-Rahim, for it is one of its Ayat (Verses)." [Reported by ad-Daraqutni who verified it as Mawquf - the saying of Abu Hurairah (RA)].

2103520.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103520
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 166
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 166
2103520.text: Narrated [Abu Hurairah (RA)]: When Allah's Messenger (RA) completed the recitation of Surat Al-Fatiha, he raised his voice and said Amin. [Reported by ad-Daraqutni who graded it Hasan (good) and Al-Hakim who graded it Sahih (authentic)).

2103530.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103530
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 167
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 167
2103530.text: The narrations of Abu Dawud and at-Tirmidhi from the Hadith of Wa'il bin Hujr (RA) are similar to this one.

2103540.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103540
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 168
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 168
2103540.text: Narrated 'Abdullah bin Abi Aufa (RA): A man came to the Prophet (ﷺ) and said, "I cannot memorize anything from the Qur'an, so teach me something which can be a substitute for me." He said, "Say Subhan Allah (Allah is Free of Imperfections) walhamdu lillah (and praise is to Allah), wa la ilaha illa-Allah (and there is nothing worthy of worship except Allah), wallahu akbar (and Allah is the Most Great), wa la hawla wa la quwwata illa billah al-'Ali al-'Adheem (and there is no might and no strength but in Allah, the Most High, the Supreme)" [Reported by Ahmad, Abu Dawud and An-Nasa'i; and Ibn Hibban, ad-Daraqutni and Al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2103550.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103550
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 169
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 169
2103550.text: Narrated Abu Qatadah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) used to lead us in prayer and recite in the first two Rak'a of the Zuhr and 'Asr prayers Surat Al-Fatiha and two (other) Surah. And he would sometimes recite loud enough for us to hear the Verses. He would prolong the first Rak'a, and would recite in the last two Rak'a Surat Al-Fatiha (only). [Agreed upon].

2103560.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103560
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 170
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 170
2103560.text: Narrated Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri (RA): We used to estimate the length of the standing position of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) in the Zuhr and 'Asr prayers, and we estimated that he stood in the first two Rak'a of the Zuhr prayer as long as it takes to recite Alif-Lam-Mim, Tanzil (Surat As-Sajdah) and in the last two Rak'a, half the time of that. And in the first two Rak'a of 'Asr, he used to stand as long as the last two of the Zuhr. And the last two Rak'a of 'Asr used to be of about half the time of the first two." [Reported by Muslim).

2103570.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103570
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 171
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 171
2103570.text: Narrated Sulaiman bin Yasar: So-and-so used to prolong the first two Rak'a of the Zuhr prayer and shorten the 'Asr prayer, and recite the short Surah of Mufassal at Maghrib prayer, its medium Surah at the 'Isha' prayer, and its long ones at the Fajr prayer. Then Abu Hurairah (RA) said: "I never prayed behind anyone whose prayer more closely resembles that of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) than this person." [Reported by an-Nasa'i with a Sahih (authentic) Isnad].

2103580.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103580
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 172
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 172
2103580.text: Narrated Jubair bin Mut'im (RA): I heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) reciting at-Tur (the Mountain - Surat No. 52) in the Maghrib (sunset) prayer. [Agreed upon).

2103590.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103590
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 173
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 173
2103590.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) used to recite during the Fajr prayer of Friday Alif-Lam-Mim, Tanzil... (as-Sajdab - Surat no. 32) and Hal ata 'alal-Insani... (al-Insan - Surat no. 76), which is also called Surat ad-Dahr). [Agreed upon].

2103600.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103600
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 174
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 174
2103600.text: at-Tabarani narrated the Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud which has the addition "... he [the Prophet (ﷺ)] did that constantly."

2103610.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103610
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 175
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 175
2103610.text: Narrated Hudhaifah (RA): I prayed with the Prophet (ﷺ) and (noticed that) whenever he came to a verse which spoke of mercy, he stopped and made supplication, and whenever he came to a verse which spoke of punishment, he stopped and sought refuge in Allah against it." [Reported by Al-Khamsah, and at-Tirmidhi graded it Hasan (good)].

2103620.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103620
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 176
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 176
2103620.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "I have been forbidden to recite the Qur'an while bowing or prostrating; so while in the bowing (position) glorify (the Perfection of) the Rabb (Lord), and while in the prostrating (position) be earnest in supplication, for it is fitting that your supplications may be answered." [Reported by Muslim].

2103630.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103630
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 177
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 177
2103630.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) used to say while bowing and prostrating Subhanaka Allahumma Rabbana wa bihamdika, Allahumma ighfir li (How Perfect You are, O Allah, Our Rabb, and praise is to You, O Allah, forgive me)." [Agreed upon].

2103640.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103640
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 178
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 178
2103640.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): When Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) got up to pray, he would say the Takbir when standing up, then would say the Takbir when bowing, then he would say Sami'Allahu liman hamidah (Allah listens to him who praises Him) when rising up from the bowing position, then he would say while standing Rabbana wa lakal-hamd (our Rabb, the praise is Yours), then he would say the Takbir when going down for prostration, then when raising his head up, then when he prostrated again, then when raising his head up. He would then do that throughout the whole Salat (prayer) and he would say the Takbir when he got up - at the end of two Rak'a - from the sitting position." [Agreed upon].

2103650.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103650
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 179
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 179
2103650.text: Narrated Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri (RA) Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) used to say while raising his head after bowing: "Allahumma Rabbana lakal-hamdu mil'as-samawati wal-ardi, wa mil'a ma shi'ta min shai'in ba'du, ahlaththana'i wal-majdi, ahaqqu ma qal-al'abdu, wa kulluna laka 'abdun. Allahumma la mani'a lima a'taita, wa la mu'tiya lima man'ata, wa la yanfa'u dhal-jaddi minka-l-jaddu (O Allah, our Rabb (Lord), to You is praise in all the heavens and all the earth, and all that You Will (to create) afterwards, O You, Who are worthy of praise and glory, the most worthy of what a slave says - and we are all Your slaves: no one can withhold what You give, or give what You withhold, and riches cannot avail a wealthy person against You." [Reported by Muslim].

2103660.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103660
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 180
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 180
2103660.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "I have been commanded to prostrate on seven bones; on the forehead - and he pointed at his nose, the hands (the palms), the knees and the tips (toes) of the feet." [Agreed upon].

2103670.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103670
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 181
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 181
2103670.text: Narrated Ibn Buhainah (RA): When the Prophet (ﷺ) prostrated while praying, he used to spread out his arms so that the whiteness of his armpits would be visible. [Agreed upon].

2103680.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103680
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 182
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 182
2103680.text: Narrated Al-Bara' bin 'Azib (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "When you prostrate, place the palms of your hands on the ground and raise your elbows." [Reported by Muslim).

2103690.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103690
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 183
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 183
2103690.text: Narrated Wa'il bin Hujr (RA): Whenever the Prophet (ﷺ) bowed, he would spread out his fingers and when he prostrated he would bring his fingers together. [Reported by al-Hakim).

2103700.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103700
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 184
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 184
2103700.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): I saw Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) praying while he sat cross-legged. [Reported by an-Nasa'i, and Ibn Khuzaimah graded it Sahib (authentic)].

2103710.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103710
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 185
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 185
2103710.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say between the two prostrations: "Allahumma ighfir li, warhamni, wahdini, wa 'afini, warzuqni (O Allah, forgive me, have mercy on me, guide me, grant me health and well-being, and provide sustenance for me)." [Reported by al-Arba'a except An-Nasa'i, and this is the wording of Abu Dawud. Al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2103720.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103720
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 186
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 186
2103720.text: Narrated Malik bin Al-Huwairith (RA): He saw the Prophet (ﷺ) praying and when he had prayed an odd number of Rak'a, he did not stand up till he had sat up properly. [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2103730.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103730
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 187
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 187
2103730.text: Narrated Anas bin Malik (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) recited Qunut (supplication in the prayer) for one month after (rising up from the) bowing (position), invoking curse on some Arab tribes. Afterwards, he gave it up. [Agreed upon].

2103740.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103740
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 188
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 188
2103740.text: Ahmad and ad-Daraqutni narrated something similar, adding that he (ﷺ) continued to recite Qunut (supplication in prayer) in the Fajr prayer till he separated from this world.

2103750.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103750
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 189
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 189
2103750.text: Narrated [Anas (RA)]: The Prophet (ﷺ) never used to supplicate [i.e. Qunut in the prayer) except when he prayed for a people or when he prayed against a people. [Ibn Khuzaimah graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2103760.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103760
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 190
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 190
2103760.text: Narrated Sa'd bin Tariq al-Ashja'i (RA): I said to my father, "You have prayed behind Allah's Messenger (ﷺ), Abu Bakr, 'Umar, Uthman, and 'Ali. Did they supplicate (with Qunut while standing) in the Fajr prayer?" He replied, "O my son, it is an innovation." [Reported by Al-Khamsah, except Abu Dawud].

2103770.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103770
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 191
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 191
2103770.text:
Narrated al-Hasan bin 'Ali (ﷺ): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) taught me some words to say when standing in supplication during the Witr, they were: "O Allah, guide me among those You have guided, grant me well-being among those You have granted well-being, take me into Your charge among those You have taken into Your charge, bless me in what You have given, guard me from the evil of what You have decreed, for You decree and none can decree over You. He whom You befriend is not humbled. Blessed and Exalted are You, our Rabb (Lord)."
Reported by Al-Khamsah: Authentic. Narrated by Abu Dawood (1425), an-Nasa'i (3/248), at-Tirmidhi (464), Ibn Majah (1178), and Ahmad (1/199-200).

at-Tabarani and al-Baihaqi added: "He whom You hold as enemy is not honoured." It is an authentic addition. Narrated by at-Tabarani in "Al-Kabeer" (3/73/2701) and al-Baihaqi in "Al-Kubra" (2/209).

an-Nasa'i reported through another chain of narrators, adding at its end: "May Allah the Most High send His Salat on the Prophet (praising him in the highest assemblies of the angels)." It is Weak. Narrated by an-Nasa'i (3/248), with the addition of "Muhammad" and its chain is disconnected, as stated by Al-Hafiz Ibn Hajar al-Asqalani in "At-Talkhees".

2103780.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103780
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 192
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 192
2103780.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) used to teach us a supplication to say in the Qunut of the morning prayer. [al-Baihaqi reported it and there is a weakness in its chain of narrators].

2103790.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103790
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 193
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 193
2103790.text:
Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "When one of you prostrates, he should not kneel in the manner of a camel, but should put down his hands before his knees." [Reported by ath-Thalathah].
This Hadith is more authentic than the Hadith narrated by Wa'il bin Hujr (RA).

2103810.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103810
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 194
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 194
2103810.text: I saw the Prophet (ﷺ) placing his knees (on the ground) before his hands when he prostrated. [Reported by al-Arba'ah].

2103820.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103820
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 195
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 195
2103820.text: The first Hadith has a Shahid (supporting evidence) in the Hadith

2103830.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103830
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 196
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 196
2103830.text: of Ibn 'Umar (RA) (coming next), which is authenticated by Ibn Khuzaimah. al-Bukhari mentioned it as a Hadith Mu'allaq (missing links from the side of the Haditb collector) and Mawquf (saying of a companion).

2103840.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103840
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 197
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 197
2103840.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): When Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) sat for at-Tashahhud, he placed his left hand on his left knee, and his right hand on his right knee, folded its fingers and pointed with his right index finger. [Reported by Muslim].

2103850.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103850
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 198
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 198
2103850.text: In another narration of Muslim: 'and he clenched all his (right hand) fingers and pointed with the index finger.'

2103860.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103860
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 199
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 199
2103860.text: Narrated 'Abdullah bin Mas'ud (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) looked at us and said, "When one of you is (sitting) in prayer, he should say, 'All services reported by words, by prayers (acts of worship), and all good things are due to Allah, peace be upon you, O Prophet, and Allah's mercy and blessings, peace be upon us and upon Allah's upright slaves. I testify that nothing deserves to be worshipped except Allah and I testify that Muhammad is His slave and Messenger.' Then he may choose any supplication which pleases him most and recite it." [Agreed upon, and this wording is from al-Bukhari].

2103870.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103870
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 200
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 200
2103870.text: In the narration of an-Nasa'i: 'We used to say before at-Tashahhud become obligatory on us'.
