2103880.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103880
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 201
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 201
2103880.text: And in the narration of Ahmad: 'The Prophet (ﷺ) taught him at-Tashahhud and ordered him to teach it to the people.'

2103890.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103890
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 202
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 202
2103890.text: In Muslim's narration from Ibn 'Abbas (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) used to teach us at-Tashahhud: "All services expressed by words, increase in good, acts of worship and all good things are due to Allah ... " till the end.

2103900.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103900
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 203
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 203
2103900.text: Narrated Fadalah bin 'Ubaid (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) heard a man supplicating during his prayer. He did not praise Allah, nor did he invoke blessings on the Prophet (ﷺ). He (ﷺ) said, "He made haste." He then called him and said, "When any of you prays, he should begin with the glorification of his Rabb (Lord) and praise Him; he should then invoke blessings on the Prophet (ﷺ); thereafter he should supplicate Allah for anything he wishes." [Ahmad and ath-Thalathah reported it; a-Tirmidhi, Ibn Hibban and al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2103910.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103910
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 204
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 204
2103910.text: Narrated Abu Mas'ud Al-Ansari (RA): Bashir bin Sa'd said, "Allah has commanded us to invoke blessings on you, O Messenger of Allah! But how should we bless you?" Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) kept quiet (a while) and then said, "Say: 'O Allah, bless Muhammad and the members of his family as You have blessed Ibrahim, and grant favours to Muhammad and the members of his family as You have granted favours to Ibrahim. In the worlds You are indeed Praiseworthy and Glorious.' And the Taslim is as you know. [Reported by Muslim].

2103920.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103920
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 205
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 205
2103920.text: Ibn Khuzaimah added to it: "How should we invoke blessings on you, whenever we invoke blessing on you in our prayers?"

2103930.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103930
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 206
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 206
2103930.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "When one of you finishes the (last) Tashahhud, he should seek refuge in Allah from four things by saying: 'O Allah I seek refuge in You against the punishment of Jahannam (Hell-fire), the punishment of the grave, the trial of life and death and the evil of the trial of Masih ad-Dajjal (Antichrist)."' [Agreed upon].

2103940.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103940
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 207
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 207
2103940.text: In the narration of Muslim: "When any of you finishes the last Tashahhud."

2103950.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103950
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 208
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 208
2103950.text: Narrated Abu Bakr as-Siddiq (RA): He said to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ), "Teach me a supplication to use in my prayer." He (ﷺ) said: "Say: O Allah, I have greatly wronged myself, and no one forgives sins except You, so grant me forgiveness from You and have mercy on me, You are the Forgiving and the Merciful One." [Agreed upon].

2103960.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103960
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 209
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 209
2103960.text: Narrated Wa'il bin Hujr (RA): I prayed with the Prophet (ﷺ) and he would give the Taslim (salutation) to his right side (saying), "Peace be upon you and the mercy and blessings of Allah"; and to his left side (saying), "Peace be upon you and mercy and the blessings of Allah." [Reported by Abu Dawud, with a Sahih (authentic) chain].

2103970.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103970
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 210
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 210
2103970.text: Narrated al-Mughira bin Shu'bah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say after every obligatory prayer: "There is nothing worthy of worship except Allah Alone, Who has no partner. To Him belongs the kingdom, to Him praise is due, and He has power over every thing. O Allah no one can withhold what You have given, or give what You have withheld and riches cannot avail a wealthy person against You." [Agreed upon].

2103980.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103980
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 211
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 211
2103980.text: Narrated Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) used to seek Allah's protection by invoking this supplication (Du'a) at the end of every Salat (prayer): "O Allah, I seek refuge in You from stinginess, I seek refuge in You from cowardice, I seek refuge in You from old age (and senility), I seek refuge in You from the temptation of the world and I seek refuge in You from the punishment in the grave." [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2103990.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2103990
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 212
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 212
2103990.text: Narrated Thauban (RA): Whenever Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) finished his prayer, he used to say after asking Allah's forgiveness three times: "O Allah, You are as-Salam (One Free from every defect), and as-Salam (safety from every evil) is (sought) from You. Blessed are You, O Possessor of glory and honour." [Reported by Muslim].

2104000.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104000
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 213
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 213
2104000.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA) Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Whoever glorifies Allah (by saying Subhan-Allah) after every Salat (prayer) thirty-three times, and praises Allah (by saying Alhamdu-lillah) thirty-three times, and exalts Allah (by saying Allahu Akbar) thirty-three times, those are ninety-nine in all, and says to complete a hundred: La ilaha ill-Allahu, wahdahu la sharika lahu, lahul-mulku wa lahulhamdu, wa Huwa 'ala kulli shai'in Qadir (There is nothing which deserves to be worshipped except Allah Alone Who has no partner; to Him belongs the kingdom, to Him praise is due, and He has power over everything), his sins will be forgiven, even if they are as abundant as the foam of the sea." [Reported by Muslim].

2104010.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104010
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 214
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 214
2104010.text: In another narration it is mentioned: "at-Takbir (Allah is the Most Great) is thirty-four times."

2104020.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104020
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 215
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 215
2104020.text: Narrated Mu'adh bin Jabal (RA) Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) told me, "O Mu'adh, I will give you some advice - Never leave the recitation of this supplication after every prayer: 'O Allah, help me to remember You, thank You, and worship You perfectly.'" [Ahmad, Abu Dawud and an-Nasa'i reported it through a strong chain of narrators].

2104030.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104030
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 216
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 216
2104030.text: Narrated Abu Umamah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Whoever recites Ayat al-Kursi at the end of every obligatory prayer, nothing but death will prevent him from entering Paradise." [An-Nasa'i reported it, and Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic).

2104040.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104040
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 217
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 217
2104040.text: at-Tabarani has the addition: "Say [O Muhammad (ﷺ)]: "He is Allah, (the) One. (Surat al-lkhlas - Surat No. 112)

2104050.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104050
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 218
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 218
2104050.text: Narrated Malik bin Al-Huwairith (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Pray as you have seen me praying." [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2104060.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104060
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 219
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 219
2104060.text: Narrated 'Imran bin Husain (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Pray standing and if you are unable, pray sitting and if you cannot, pray lying on your side, [otherwise pray by signs]." [Reported by al-Bukhari, (without the final words)].

2104070.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104070
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 220
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 220
2104070.text: Narrated Jabir (RA): The saying of the Prophet (ﷺ) to a sick person who prayed on a cushion: The Prophet (ﷺ) threw it away and said, "Pray on the ground, if you are able to do so; otherwise, pray by gesturing signs and make your prostration lower than your bowing." [al-Baihaqi reported it through a strong chain of narrators, but Abu Hatim regarded it as Mauquf (saying of a Companion)].

2104080.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104080
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 221
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 221
2104080.text: Narrated 'Abdullah bin Buhainah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) led them in the Zuhr prayer, and when he stood up at the end of the first two Rak'at and did not sit, the people stood up with him. When he finished the Salat (prayer) and the people expected him to do the Taslim (salutation), he uttered the Takbir while sitting and made two prostrations before saying the Taslim (salutation), then he uttered the Taslim (salutation). [Reported by as-Sab'ah and this is al-Bukhari's wording].

2104090.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104090
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 222
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 222
2104090.text: In the narration of Muslim it is mentioned that, "He (ﷺ) uttered the Takbir for each prostration while sitting and the people prostrated with him to make up for the sitting he had forgotten."

2104100.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104100
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 223
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 223
2104100.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) led us in two Rak'at of one of the two, Zuhr or 'Asr prayers, and said the Taslim (salutation). He then got up and went towards a piece of wood which was at the front part of the mosque and placed his hands upon it. Abu Bakr and 'Umar were among the people, but they were afraid to speak to him. Then some of the hasty type of people came out and said, "Has the Salat (prayer) been shortened?" A man whom the Prophet (ﷺ) called Dhul Yadain (the long armed) asked: "Have you forgotten, O Allah's Messenger or has the prayer been shortened?" He said, "I have neither forgotten nor has it been shortened." He said, "Indeed you have forgotten." He [the Prophet (ﷺ)] then prayed the remaining two Rak'at, then said the Taslim (salutation). He then uttered the Takbir and prostrated similar to his normal prostration or longer, then raised up his head and uttered the Takbir. He then prostrated and uttered the Takbir, and the prostration was similar to his normal prostration or longer. He then raised his head and uttered the Takbir. [Agreed upon, and it is al-Bukhari's wording].

2104110.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104110
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 224
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 224
2104110.text: And in the narration of Muslim: "'Asr prayer".

2104120.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104120
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 225
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 225
2104120.text: And in Abu Dawud: "He said, 'Has Dhul-Yadain spoken the truth?' Then they said 'Yes' with gesture".

2104130.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104130
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 226
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 226
2104130.text: This is found in Sahihain, but with the word "Fa qalu".

2104140.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104140
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 227
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 227
2104140.text: And in another narration: "and he did not prostrate till Allah made him certain of this (i.e. as-Sahw)."

2104150.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104150
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 228
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 228
2104150.text: Narrated 'Imran bin Husain (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) led them [the Companions (RA)] in prayer and forgot (something). He then made two prostrations and then said the Tashahhud and uttered the Taslim (salutation). [Reported by Abu Dawud, and at-Tirmidhi who graded it Hasan (good), and al-Hakim who graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2104160.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104160
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 229
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 229
2104160.text: Narrated Abu Sa'id al-Khudri (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "When anyone of you is in doubt about his Salat (prayer) and does not know how many he has prayed, three or four (Rak'at) he should cast aside his doubt and base his prayer on what he is sure of. Then, he should perform two prostrations before Taslim (salutation). If he has prayed five Rak'at, they will make his Salat (prayer) an even number for him and if he has prayed exactly four, they (i.e. two prostrations) will be humiliation for the devil." [Reported by Muslim].

2104170.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104170
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 230
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 230
2104170.text: Narrated Ibn Mas'ud (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) offered prayer and when he said Taslim (salutation), he was asked, "O Allah's Messenger! Has something new happened to the Salat (prayer)?" He asked, "What is that?" They said, "You have prayed so many and so many (Rak'at)." He [Ibn Mas'ud (RA)] said, "He then bent his legs, faced the Qiblab, and made two prostrations and then said the Taslim (salutations). Then he faced us and said, "If something new is introduced to the Salat (prayer), I shall inform you but I am a human being like you, I forget just as you forget; so if I forget remind me and if any of you is in doubt about his Salat (prayer) he should act upon what he thinks is correct and complete his prayer in that respect and then he should make two prostrations." [Agreed upon].

2104180.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104180
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 231
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 231
2104180.text: And in the narration of al-Bukhari: 'he should complete (the prayer) then he should say Taslim and then perform the prostration'.

2104190.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104190
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 232
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 232
2104190.text: And in the narration of Muslim: 'the Prophet (ﷺ) performed two Sajdatus-Sabw after Taslim and talking'.

2104200.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104200
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 233
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 233
2104200.text: In the narration of Ahmad, Abu Dawud and an-Nasa'i from the Hadith of 'Abdullah bin Ja'far (RA) Marfu' [attributed to the Prophet(ﷺ)]: 'Whoever doubts about his Salat (prayer), should make two prostrations after the Taslim (salutations).' [Ibn Khuzaimah graded it Sahib (authentic)].

2104210.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104210
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 234
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 234
2104210.text: Narrated al-Mughira bin Shu'ba (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "When one of you doubts and stands at the end of two Rak'at, if he remembers while having stood up completely he should continue and should not return (to the sitting position) and he should make two prostrations, but if he did not stand up straight he should sit down and there is no forgetfulness (prostration) upon him." [Reported Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, and ad-Daraqutni, with a weak Sanad (chain); the wording is ad-Daraqutni's].

2104220.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104220
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 235
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 235
2104220.text: Narrated 'Umar (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "There is no (prostrations of) forgetfulness for one who is led (in prayer) by an Imam, but when the Imam forgets, both should then make prostrations due to forgetfulness." [al-Bazzar and al-Baihaqi reported it through a weak chain of narrators].

2104230.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104230
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 236
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 236
2104230.text: Narrated Thawban (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "There are two prostrations after the Taslim (salutation) for each forgetfulness." [Abu Dawud and Ibn Majah reported it through a weak chain of narrators].

2104250.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104250
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 237
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 237
2104250.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): We prostrated with Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) (as he recited these Surah) "When the heaven split asunder" (Surah 84) and "Read in the Name of your Lord" (Surah 96). [Reported by Muslim).

2104260.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104260
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 238
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 238
2104260.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): A prostration while reciting Surat Sad (Surah 38) is not one of the 'Azaa'im (those which are always required), but I have seen Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) prostrating while reciting it. [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2104270.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104270
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 239
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 239
2104270.text: Narrated [Ibn 'Abbas (RA)]: The Prophet (ﷺ) prostrated in Surat an-Najm (Chapter 53). [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2104280.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104280
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 240
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 240
2104280.text: Narrated Zaid bin Thabit (RA): I recited to the Prophet (ﷺ) "an-Najm" (Surah 53) but he did not prostrate in it. [Agreed upon).

2104290.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104290
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 241
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 241
2104290.text: Narrated Khalid bin Ma'dan (RA): Surat al-Hajj has been distinguished by two prostrations. [Abu Dawud reported it among al-Marasil (a broken chain after the Tabi'i)].

2104300.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104300
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 242
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 242
2104300.text: Ahmad and at-Tirmidhi reported the above Hadith through a full chain of narrators from 'Uqba bin 'Aamir. It has the addition: "If anyone does not make two prostrations (when reciting Surat Al-Hajj), he should not recite it." [The chain of this Haditb is Da'if (weak)].

2104310.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104310
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 243
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 243
2104310.text: Narrated 'Umar (RA): He said, "O people! We pass (in our recitation) verses to be prostrated at, so whoever prostrates has done the right thing, and there is no sin upon the one who does not prostrate." [al-Bukhari reported it]. It also contains the words: 'Allah the Most High has not made the prostration (of recitation) compulsory, unless one wishes (to do so).' [This Hadith is in the Muwatta' of Imam Malik).

2104320.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104320
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 244
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 244
2104320.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) used to recite the Qur'an to us, and when he came to a place where a prostration should be made, he uttered the Takbir and prostrated and we prostrated with him. [Reported by Abu Dawud through a chain containing some weakness].

2104330.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104330
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 245
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 245
2104330.text: Narrated Abu Bakra (RA): Whenever the Prophet (ﷺ) received a matter which pleased him he used to prostrate to Allah [out of thankfulness]. [Reported by al-Khamsa except an-Nasa'i].

2104340.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104340
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 246
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 246
2104340.text: Narrated 'Abdur-Rahman bin 'Auf (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) prostrated and prolonged the Sajda, he then raised his head and said, "Jibrael (Gabriel) had come and given me glad tidings, thereafter I prostrated in gratitude to Allah." [Ahmad reported it and al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2104350.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104350
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 247
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 247
2104350.text: Narrated Al-Bara' bin 'Azib (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) sent 'Ali to Yemen. The narrator mentioned the complete Hadith. He said, "Ali sent a letter regarding their (the people of Yemen) acceptance of Islam. When Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) read the letter, he prostrated in gratitude to Allah the Most High for that." [Reported by al-Baihaqi].

2104360.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104360
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 248
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 248
2104360.text: And its basic meaning is found in Sahih al-Bukhari.

2104370.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104370
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 249
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 249
2104370.text: Narrated Rabi'ah bin Ka'b al-Aslami (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said to me, "Ask." I said, "I ask your company in Paradise." He replied, "Or something else?" I said, "That is it (i.e. that is what I desire)." He said, "Then help me to achieve this for you by devoting yourself often to prostration." [Reported by Muslim].

2104380.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104380
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 250
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 250
2104380.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): I memorized from the Prophet (ﷺ) ten (voluntary) Rak'at - two Rak'at before the Zuhr prayer and two after it; two Rak'at after Maghrib prayer in his house, and two Rak'at after 'Isha' prayer in his house, and two Rak'at before the Fajr prayer. [Agreed upon].

2104390.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104390
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 251
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 251
2104390.text: Another narration of both (al-Bukhari and Muslim) has: 'two Rak'at after Jumu'ah prayer in his house.'

2104400.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104400
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 252
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 252
2104400.text: Muslim has: 'He never prayed after the break of dawn except two light Rak'at.'

2104410.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104410
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 253
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 253
2104410.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) never left four Rak'at before the Zuhr prayer, and two Rak'at before the Fajr prayer. [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2104420.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104420
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 254
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 254
2104420.text: Narrated ['Aishah (RA)]: The Prophet (ﷺ) was more particular about offering the two (optional) Rak'at at dawn than he was about offering any of the other optional prayers. [Agreed upon].

2104430.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104430
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 255
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 255
2104430.text: Muslim has: "The two Rak'at at dawn are better than this world and what it contains."

2104440.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104440
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 256
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 256
2104440.text: Narrated Umm Habibah (RA) the Mother of the Believers: She heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) say, "Whoever prays twelve (voluntary) Rak'at in a day and a night, a house will be built for him in Paradise due to them (the Rak'at)." [Reported by Muslim]. In another narration, it is mentioned: "Voluntarily".

2104450.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104450
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 257
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 257
2104450.text: at-Tirmidhi reported it similarly and added: "four Rak'at before Zuhr and two Rak'at after it and two Ra'kat after Maghrib and two after 'Isha' and two Rak'at before the Fajr prayer."

2104460.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104460
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 258
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 258
2104460.text: And in the narration of al-Khamsah, by her [Umm Habibah (RA)]: "Whoever prays regularly four Rak'at before and four Rak'at after the Zuhr prayer, Allah will forbid for him (from entering) the Hellfire."

2104470.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104470
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 259
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 259
2104470.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "May Allah mercy on a person who prays four Rak'at before the 'Asr prayer. " [Reported by Ahmad, Abu Da'ud and at-Tirmidhi and the latter graded it Hasan (good). Also reported by Ibn Khuzaimah who graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2104480.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104480
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 260
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 260
2104480.text: Narrated 'Abdullah bin Mughaffal al-Muzani (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Pray before Maghrib, pray before Maghrib" then he said at the third time, "Whoever wishes (to)". He said so, because he did not like the people to take it as a Sunnah. [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2104490.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104490
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 261
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 261
2104490.text: And in the narration of Ibn Hibban: "The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed two Rak'at before the Maghrib (prayer)."

2104500.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104500
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 262
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 262
2104500.text: Muslim has reported from Anas (RA) that he said, "We used to pray two Rak'at after sunset and the Prophet (ﷺ) used to see us, but he neither commanded nor forbade us."

2104510.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104510
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 263
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 263
2104510.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) used to make the two (voluntary) Rak'at before the Fajr prayer so short that I would wonder whether he recited al-Fatiha (or not). [Agreed upon].

2104520.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104520
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 264
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 264
2104520.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) recited Surat al-Kafirun, and Surat al-Ikhlas in the two (voluntary) Rak'at of the Fajr (prayer). [Reported by Muslim].

2104530.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104530
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 265
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 265
2104530.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) used to lie down on his right side, after praying the two (voluntary) Rak'at of the Fajr (prayer). [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2104540.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104540
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 266
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 266
2104540.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "If any of you prays the two Rak'at before the dawn prayer, he should lie on his right side." [Reported by Ahmad, Abu Dawud and at-Tirmidhi, the latter graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2104550.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104550
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 267
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 267
2104550.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The (voluntary) night prayers are two Rak'at, two Rak'at (in pairs), and if one fears that the dawn prayer is due, he should then offer one Rak'at which will make what he has prayed an odd number." [Agreed upon).

2104560.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104560
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 268
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 268
2104560.text: The Khamsah reported it - graded Sahib (authentic) by Ibn Hibban - with the wording: "the (voluntary) day and night prayers are two Rak'at, two Rak'at (in pairs)." an-Nasa'i said, "This is a mistake."

2104570.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104570
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 269
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 269
2104570.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The most excellent prayer after that which is obligatory is the (voluntary) late night prayer." [Reported by Muslim].

2104580.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104580
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 270
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 270
2104580.text: Narrated Abu Ayub al-Ansari (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "al-Witr prayer is a duty upon every Muslim, so whoever likes to offer it with five Rak'at let him do so and whoever likes to offer it with three let him do so, and whoever likes to offer it with one let him do so." [Reported by al-Arba'ah except at-Tirmidhi. And Ibn Hibban graded it Sahib (authentic) and an-Nasa'i held that the stronger view is that it is Mawquf (saying of a companion)].

2104590.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104590
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 271
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 271
2104590.text: Narrated 'Ali bin Abu Talib (RA): The Witr prayer is not obligatory as the prescribed prayer is [i.e. the five daily prayers], but it is a Sunnah which was established by the practice of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). [at-Tirmidhi and an-Nasa'i reported it, who graded it Hasan (good). al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2104600.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104600
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 272
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 272
2104600.text: Narrated Jabir (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) prayed during the month of Ramadan. Then they (the Sahabah) waited for him on the following night, but he did not come out and he said, "I feared that the Witr (prayer) might be prescribed for you." [Reported by Ibn Hibban].

2104610.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104610
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 273
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 273
2104610.text: Narrated Kharijah bin Hudhaifah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Allah the Exalted has given you an extra prayer which is better for you than the red camels (high breed camels)." We asked, "What is it O Allah's Messenger." He said, "The Witr between the 'Isha' prayer and up till the break of dawn." [Reported by al-Khamsah except an-Nasa'i and al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2104620.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104620
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 274
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 274
2104620.text: Ahmad reported something similar to the above Hadith from 'Amr bin Shu'aib on the authority of his father who reported it on the authority of 'Amr's grandfather.

2104630.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104630
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 275
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 275
2104630.text: Narrated 'Abdullah bin Buraidah (RA) from his father: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The Witr is a duty, so he who does not offer it, is not one of us." [Reported by Abu Dawud with a Laiyin (weak) chain of narrators and Al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2104640.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104640
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 276
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 276
2104640.text: The above mentioned Hadith has a Shahid (supporting narration) which is weak, reported by Ahmad from Abu Hurairah (RA).

2104650.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104650
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 277
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 277
2104650.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) did not offer more than eleven (voluntary) Rak'at during Ramadan nor during other than Ramadan. He offered four Rak'at - Do not ask about their beauty and length! (It is beyond description or imitation]. Again he would pray four Rak'at - Do not ask about their beauty and length! [It is beyond description or imitation]. Then he would pray three (Rak'at of Witr). 'Aishah (RA) said: "I said, O Allah's Messenger will you sleep before you pray Witr?" He said, "O 'Aishah my eyes sleep, but my heart does not sleep." [Agreed upon].

2104660.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104660
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 278
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 278
2104660.text: And in another narration of al-Bukhari and Muslim, ['Aishah (RA)] narrated: "He used to pray ten Rak'at (of prayer), and making it Witr by one Rak'at, and he used to pray the two (Sunnah) Rak'at of Fajr, so that it became thirteen Rak'at."

2104670.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104670
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 279
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 279
2104670.text: Narrated ['Aishah (RA)]: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) used to pray thirteen Rak'at during the night, offering a Witr out of that with five and sitting only during the last of them. [Agreed upon].

2104680.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104680
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 280
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 280
2104680.text: Narrated ['Aishah (RA)]: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) offered Witr prayer (on different nights) at various hours, extending (from the 'Isha' prayer) up to the last hour of the night. [Agreed upon].

2104690.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104690
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 281
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 281
2104690.text: Narrated 'Abdullah bin 'Amr bin al-'Aas (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) told me, "O 'Abdullah! Do not be like so-and-so who used to be awake in the night for prayer and then gave it up." [Agreed upon].

2104700.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104700
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 282
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 282
2104700.text: Narrated 'Ali bin Abi Talib (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "O people of the Qur'an! Offer Witr (prayer), because Allah is Witr (One) and loves Witr." [Reported by al-Khamsah and Ibn Khuzaimah graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2104710.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104710
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 283
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 283
2104710.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Make the last of your prayer at night Witr (an odd number)." [Agreed upon].

2104720.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104720
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 284
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 284
2104720.text: Narrated Talq bin 'Ali (RA): I heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) saying, "There are no two Witr (prayers) during one night." [Reported by Ahmad and ath-Thalathah and Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2104730.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104730
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 285
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 285
2104730.text: Narrated Ubai bin Ka'b (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) recited in Witr prayer Surat al-A'la (in the first Rak'at), Surat al-Kafirun (in the second Rak'at) and Surat al-Ikhlas (in the third Rak'at). [Reported by Ahmad, Abu Dawud and an-Nasa'i]. The latter added, "And he did not say the Taslim (salutation) except in the last (Rak'at) of them."

2104740.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104740
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 286
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 286
2104740.text: Abu Dawud and at-Tirmidhi report something similar from 'Aishah (RA) that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) used to recite a Surat in every Rak'at and in the last (third) Rak'at he would recite Qul Huwa Allahu Ahad (Surat al-Ikhlas) and al-Mu'awwidhatain.

2104750.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104750
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 287
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 287
2104750.text: Narrated Abu Sa'id al-Khudri (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Offer Witr prayer before it is morning." [Reported by Muslim].

2104760.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104760
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 288
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 288
2104760.text: Ibn Hibban has: 'Whosoever reaches the dawn, and he did not offer Witr, then there is no Witr for him.'

2104770.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104770
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 289
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 289
2104770.text: Narrated [Abu Sa'id al-Khudri (RA)]: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Whoever oversleeps and misses the Witr, or forgets it, should pray (when he awakens) in the moming or when he remembers." [Reported by al-Khamsah except an-Nasa'i].

2104780.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104780
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 290
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 290
2104780.text: Narrated Jabir (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "If anyone is afraid that he may not get up in the latter part of the night, he should offer Witr in the first part of it; and if anyone expects to get up in the last part of it, he should offer Witr at the end of the night, for prayer at the end of the night is witnessed (by the angels) and that is preferable." [Reported by Muslim].

2104790.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104790
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 291
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 291
2104790.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "When the dawn breaks, then the time of all night prayers including the Witr is over, so observe the Witr before dawn." [Reported by at-Tirmidhi].

2104800.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104800
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 292
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 292
2104800.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) used to pray four Rak'at in Duha prayer and increase (the number of Rak'at) as much as Allah willed." [Reported by Muslim].

2104810.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104810
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 293
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 293
2104810.text: In another narration of Muslim from her: ['Aishah (RA)] was asked, "Did Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) use to offer the Duha prayer?" She replied, "No, unless he came back from a journey."

2104820.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104820
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 294
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 294
2104820.text: In yet another narration of Muslim from her: ['Aishah (RA)] said, "I have never seen Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) offering Duha prayer, yet I offer it."

2104830.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104830
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 295
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 295
2104830.text: Narrated Zaid bin Arqam (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The prayer of those who are penitent is offered when the young weaned camels feel the heat of the sand." [Reported by at-Tirmidhi].

2104840.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104840
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 296
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 296
2104840.text: Narrated Anas (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Whoever prays twelve Rak'at of Duha, Allah will build a castle for him in Paradise." [Reported by at-Tirmidhi who graded it Gharib (reported by a single narrator)].

2104850.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104850
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 297
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 297
2104850.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) entered my house and prayed eight Rak'at of Duha prayer. [Reported by Ibn Hibban in his Sahih].

2104860.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104860
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 298
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 298
2104860.text: Narrated 'Abdullah bin 'Umar (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The prayer offered in congregation is twenty-seven degrees more rewardable than a prayer offered by a single person." [Agreed upon].

2104870.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104870
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 299
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 299
2104870.text: Both al-Bukhari and Muslim have also reported through Abu Hurairah (RA): "Twenty-five degrees (more)."

2104880.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104880
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 300
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 300
2104880.text: Likewise, al-Bukhari reported from Abu Sa'id al-Khudri: "He (ﷺ) said (the word) Daraja (degree)."

2104890.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104890
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 301
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 301
2104890.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "By Him in Whose Hand my soul is, I have thought of giving orders for fuel wood to be gathered, then giving orders for Salat (prayer) and having the Adhan called, then ordering a man to lead the people (in prayer), then going off to some people (men) who are not present at the prayer and burning down their houses upon them. By Him in Whose Hand my soul is, if one of them knew he would find a fat meaty bone or two fine sheep hooves he would attend the 'Isha' (evening prayer)." [Agreed upon, and the wording is that of al-Bukhari].

2104900.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104900
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 302
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 302
2104900.text: Narrated [Abu Hurairah (RA)]: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The most burdensome prayers for hypocrites are the 'Isha' and the Fajr prayers and if they knew what (rewards) these (prayers) contain, they would have come to them (in the mosques), even though they had to crawl on their knees." [Agreed upon].

2104910.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104910
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 303
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 303
2104910.text: Narrated [Abu Hurairah (RA)]: A blind man came to the Prophet (ﷺ) and said, "O Messenger of Allah, I have no guide to take me to the mosque." He [the Prophet (ﷺ)] therefore permitted him (to pray at his house), then when the man turned away the Prophet (ﷺ) called him and asked, "Can you hear the Adhan (call) for prayer?" He answered, "Yes". He [the Prophet (ﷺ)] said, "Then respond to it." [Reported by Muslim].

2104920.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104920
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 304
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 304
2104920.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Whoever hears the call for prayer and and does not come (to the mosque for prayer), his prayer will not be accepted from him, unless he has a (legitimate) excuse." [Reported by Ibn Majah, ad-Daraqutni, Ibn Hibban and al-Hakim. Its chain of narration meets Muslim's conditions, but some Hadith scholars held that the stronger view is that it is Mawquf (saying of a Companion)].

2104930.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104930
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 305
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 305
2104930.text: Narrated Yazid bin al-Aswad (RA): He offered the morning prayer with Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and when Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) finished his prayer, he saw two men who had not prayed with him. He ordered them to be brought and they were brought trembling with fear. He asked them what had prevented you from praying with us?" They said, "We had already prayed at our homes." He said, "Don't do so! If you pray at your homes and then you come while the Imam has not yet performed the prayer, you must pray with him, and it will be a voluntary prayer for you." [Reported by Ahmad - with his wording - and ath-Thalathah. at-Tirmidhi and Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2104940.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104940
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 306
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 306
2104940.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA) : Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The Imam has been appointed to be followed (in the congregational prayers). So, when he utters the Takbir, utter the Takbir too, and do not utter the Takbir until he utters it. When he bows, you should bow, and do not bow until he bows. When he says, "Allah listens to him who praises him," say, "O Allah, our Rabb, to you is the praise." When he prostrates, you prostrate; and do not prostrate until he prostrates. If he prays standing, pray standing, and if he prays sitting, all of you pray sitting." [Reported by Abu Dawud and the wording is his].

2104950.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104950
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 307
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 307
2104950.text: And its basic meaning is in the Sahihain (of al-Bukhari and Muslim)].

2104960.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104960
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 308
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 308
2104960.text: Narrated Abu Sa'id al-Khudri (RA): When Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) saw a tendency among his Companions of going to the back he said, "Come forward and follow my lead and let those behind you follow you." [Reported by Muslim].

2104970.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104970
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 309
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 309
2104970.text: Narrated Zaid bin Thabit (RA): Allah's (ﷺ) made a small room of a mat (i.e. he used it to designate a space for prayer) and prayed inside it. The people followed him, and they came to pray behind him. The narrator mentioned the rest of the Hadith, and it contains the words: "The most excellent prayer of a person is (that which he prays) in his house except that which is prescribed (the five congregational prayers)." [Agreed upon].

2104980.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104980
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 310
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 310
2104980.text: Narrated Jabir (RA): Mu'adh bin Jabal (RA) led his companions in the al-'Isha (night prayer) and prolonged it for them. Upon this the Prophet (ﷺ) said to him, "O Mu'adh, do you want to become a Fattan? When you lead people in prayers, recite ash-Shamsi wa duhaha (Surat 91), Sabbihisma Rabbikal-A'la (Surat 87), Iqra' Bismi Rabbika (Surat 96) and Wal-Laili idha yaghsha (Surat 92)." [Agreed upon. And the wording is from Muslim].

2104990.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2104990
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 311
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 311
2104990.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA) regarding Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) leading the people in Salat (prayer) during his illness. She said, "He came and sat on the left side of Abu Bakr (RA). So he (ﷺ) was leading the people in prayer while sitting and Abu Bakr standing. Abu Bakr was following the prayer of the Prophet (ﷺ), and the people were following the prayer of Abu Bakr." [Agreed upon].

2105000.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105000
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 312
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 312
2105000.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "When one of you leads the people in prayer he should be brief, for among them are the young and the old, the weak and those who have needs to attend to. But if he prays by himself he may pray as he wishes." [Agreed upon].

2105010.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105010
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 313
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 313
2105010.text: Narrated 'Amr bin Salimah (RA): My father said, "I have come from the true Prophet (ﷺ), so when the time of Salat (prayer) comes one of you should announce the Adhan and the one of you who knows the Qur'an most should be your Imam." He ('Amr) said: "They looked around and there was no one who knew the Qur'an more than I. So they put me forward in front of them and I was only six or seven years old." [Reported by al-Bukhari, Abu Dawud and an-Nasa'i].

2105020.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105020
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 314
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 314
2105020.text: Narrated Ibn Mas'ud (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The one who knows [by recitation and memorization] the Book of Allah most should be the Imam of the people. If they are equal in the recitation, then the one who knows the Sunnah most and if they are equal in the Sunnah then the earliest of them to emigrate (to al-Madinah) and if they are equal in the emigration then the oldest among them in Islam. In another narration it has "agewise". And no man should lead another in prayer in his domain or sit in his place of honor without his permission." [Reported by Muslim].

2105030.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105030
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 315
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 315
2105030.text: Ibn Majah reported the following from Jabir's narration, "A woman is never to lead a man in prayer, neither a bedouin (desert Arab) to lead an emigrant, nor a sinner to lead a believer." [Its chain of narrators is Wahin (extremely weak)].

2105040.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105040
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 316
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 316
2105040.text: Narrated Anas (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Stand close together in your rows, bring them (the rows) near one another, and stand neck to neck (in straight lines)." [Reported by Abu Dawud and an-Nasa'i. And Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2105050.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105050
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 317
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 317
2105050.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The best of the men's rows is the first and the worst is the last; and the best of the women's rows is the last and the worst is the first." [Reported by Muslim].

2105060.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105060
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 318
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 318
2105060.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): "I prayed (the night Tahajjud prayer) with Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) one night and I stood on his left side, whereupon he took me by the back of my head and made me go round to his right side. [Agreed upon].

2105070.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105070
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 319
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 319
2105070.text: Narrated Anas (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) prayed and an orphan and I prayed behind him and Umm Sulaim (RA) was behind us. [Agreed upon and the wording is al-Bukhari's].

2105080.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105080
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 320
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 320
2105080.text: Narrated Abu Bakrah (RA): He reached the Prophet (ﷺ) while he was bowing, so he (Abu Bakrah) bowed before reaching the row. He mentioned that to the Prophet (ﷺ) and the Prophet (ﷺ) said to him, "May Allah increase your eagerness! But do not repeat." [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2105090.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105090
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 321
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 321
2105090.text: And Abu Dawud added: "He bowed before reaching the row then walked and joined the row."

2105100.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105100
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 322
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 322
2105100.text: Narrated Wabisah bin Ma'bad: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) saw a man praying alone behind the row so he ordered him to repeat the Salat (prayer). [Reported by Ahmad, Abu Dawud and at-Tirmidhi. The latter graded it Hasan, and Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2105110.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105110
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 323
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 323
2105110.text: Ibn Hibban reported this from Talq [bin 'Ali (RA)]: "The prayer of a person who prays alone behind the row is not accepted.

2105120.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105120
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 324
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 324
2105120.text: And at-Tabarani added to the narration of Wabisah, "Why did you not join them or pull back a man (to your position)?"

2105130.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105130
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 325
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 325
2105130.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "If you hear the Iqamah, you must walk to the prayer (place) with tranquility and dignity, and do not hasten; and whatever portion of the prayer you get (along with the Imam) offer it, and complete afterwards whatever you missed. [Agreed upon, and the wording is al-Bukhari's).

2105140.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105140
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 326
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 326
2105140.text: Narrated 'Ubai bin Ka'b (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "A man's prayer offered with another man is purer than his prayer which he offers alone, and his prayer with two men is purer than his prayer with one and if they are more (in number), it is more beloved to Allah, the Mighty the Majestic." [Reported by Abu Dawud and an-Nasa'i. And Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2105150.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105150
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 327
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 327
2105150.text: Narrated Umm Waraqah: The Prophet (ﷺ) commanded her to lead the members of her household (in prayer). [Reported by Abu Dawud; Ibn Khuzaimah graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2105160.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105160
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 328
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 328
2105160.text: Narrated Anas (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) appointed Ibn Umm Maktum (RA) to lead the people in prayer in his absence and he [Ibn Umm Maktum (RA)] was blind. [Reported by Ahmad and Abu Dawud].

2105170.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105170
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 329
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 329
2105170.text: Ibn Hibban also reported something similar from 'Aishah (RA).

2105180.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105180
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 330
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 330
2105180.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Pray (funeral prayers) over him who said (believed): 'Nothing deserves to be worshiped except Allah'; and pray behind him who says: 'Nothing deserves to be worshiped except Allah'." [ad-Daraqutni reported it through a weak chain of narrators].

2105190.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105190
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 331
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 331
2105190.text: Narrated 'Ali bin Abi Talib (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "If one of you comes to Salat (prayer) and the Imam is at a certain position, he must do as the Imam is doing." [Reported by at-Tirmidhi with a weak chain of narrators].

2105200.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105200
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 332
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 332
2105200.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA) that when the Salat (prayer) was first prescribed, it consisted of two Rak'at. Afterwards, the prayer during travelling was confirmed (as two Rak'at), while the prayer at the place of residence was completed (as four Rak'at). [Agreed upon].

2105210.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105210
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 333
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 333
2105210.text: al-Bukhari has: 'Then [(Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)] emigrated and it was prescribed as four, but prayer while travelling was left according to the original prescription (of two Rak'at).'

2105220.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105220
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 334
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 334
2105220.text: Ahmad added, 'Except the Maghrib (prayer) for it is the Witr (prayer) of the day; and except the Fajr (prayer), since the recitation (of the Qur'an) is prolonged in it.'

2105230.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105230
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 335
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 335
2105230.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): While on a journey, the Prophet (ﷺ) used to shorten the prayer (sometimes) and offer it completely (sometimes). Similarly, he used to observe fast (sometimes) and break it (sometimes). [ad-Daraqutni reported it, and its narrators are reliable, but it is a defective Hadith].

2105240.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105240
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 336
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 336
2105240.text: The Mahfudh (correct) narration from 'Aishah (RA) (concerning this matter) is that it was her practice (that she (RA) offered prayers in the complete form during travelling) [and not the practice of the Prophet (ﷺ)]. She said: 'It is not hard for me.' [al-Baihaqi reported it].

2105250.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105250
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 337
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 337
2105250.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Allah the Most High loves that His permissions be practiced, just as he dislikes that disobedience to Him be committed." [Ahmad reported it. Ibn Khuzaimah and Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2105260.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105260
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 338
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 338
2105260.text: A narration has, "As He loves that His... duties be observed."

2105270.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105270
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 339
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 339
2105270.text:
Narrated Anas (RA): When Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) went out on a journey of three miles or three Farasikh, he (ﷺ) used to pray two Rak'at. [Reported by Muslim].

Farasikh (plural of Farsakh) is Persian unit of distance. Farsakh is equal to about three miles.

2105280.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105280
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 340
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 340
2105280.text: Narrated [Anas (RA)]: We went from al-Madinah to Makkah with Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and he prayed two Rak'at at each time of prayer till we returned to al-Madinah. [Agreed upon, and the wording is al-Bukhari's].

2105290.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105290
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 341
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 341
2105290.text:
Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) (made a journey during which) he had a stop of nineteen days, during which he shortened his prayers. [Al-Bukhari]

And in a narration: "(he (ﷺ) stayed) nineteen days in Makkah."

2105300.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105300
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 342
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 342
2105300.text: In a narration of Abu Dawud: "seventeen days."

2105310.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105310
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 343
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 343

2105320.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105320
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 344
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 344
2105320.text: The narration of Abu Dawud from 'Imran bin Husain (RA) has: "eighteen days."

2105330.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105330
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 345
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 345
2105330.text: His narration from Jabir (RA) has: Allah's Messenger (RA) stayed at Tabuk for twenty days, and he shortened the prayers (during his stay). [Its narrators are reliable, except that there is difference about whether or not it is Mawsul (unbroken chain of narrators)].

2105340.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105340
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 346
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 346
2105340.text: Narrated Anas (RA): When Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) (while on a journey) proceeded before the sun had declined from the centre of the sky, he (ﷺ) delayed the Zuhr prayer till the time of the 'Asr prayer; he (ﷺ) would then alight and combine the two prayers. If the sun declined before he (ﷺ) moved off, he (ﷺ) would offer the Zuhr prayer and ride (i.e. travel). [Agreed upon].

2105350.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105350
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 347
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 347
2105350.text: In the narration of al-Hakim quoted in the al-Arba'in with a Sahih Isnad, "He (ﷺ) prayed Zuhr and 'Asr then rode (his beast, to continue his journey.)"

2105360.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105360
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 348
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 348
2105360.text: Abu Nu'aim has in his Mustakhraj of Muslim, "While on a journey, if the sun declined he (ﷺ) used to pray Zuhr and 'Asr together and then continue his journey."

2105370.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105370
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 349
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 349
2105370.text: Narrated Mu'adh bin Jabal (RA): We went out with Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) on the Tabuk expedition, and he would offer Zuhr and 'Asr prayers together and Magbrib and 'Isha' prayers together. [Reported by Muslim].

2105380.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105380
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 350
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 350
2105380.text:
Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Do not shorten the prayer (while travelling) for a distance of less than four Burud; from Makkah to 'Usfan." [ad-Daraqutni reported it through a weak chain of narrators, and the right opinion is that it is Mawquf (saying of a companion, i.e. Ibn 'Abbas). Ibn Khuzaima reported it as such].

Burud: Plural of Barid, which means three Farsakh, and one Farsakh is equal to three miles.

2105390.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105390
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 351
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 351
2105390.text: Narrated Jabir (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The best of my followers are those who, having done evil, ask for forgiveness (from Allah); and when on a journey, shorten (the prayer) and break the fast." [at-Tabarani reported it in al-'Awsat through a weak chain of narrators].

2105400.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105400
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 352
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 352
2105400.text: al-Baihaqi reported it in brief as a Mursal (missing link after the Tabi'i) from Sa'id bin al-Musaiyab.

2105410.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105410
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 353
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 353
2105410.text: Narrated 'Imran bin Husain (RA): I suffered from piles. So I asked the Prophet (ﷺ) about the prayers. He said: "Pray standing; and if you are unable, (pray) sitting; and if you are unable, (pray) lying on your side." [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2105420.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105420
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 354
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 354
2105420.text: Narrated Jabir (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) visited a sick man and saw him praying on a cushion, he threw it away and said, "Pray on the ground, if you can, or else pray by gestures and make your prostration lower than your bowing." [al-Baihaqi reported it and Abu Hatim graded it Sahih (authentic) in Mawquf form (as a saying of a companion, i.e. Jabir)].

2105430.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105430
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 355
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 355
2105430.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): I saw the Prophet (ﷺ) praying while sitted in a cross-legged position. [Reported by an-Nasa'i; and al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2105440.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105440
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 356
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 356
2105440.text: Narrated 'Abdullah bin 'Umar and Abu Hurairah (RA): They heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) say (while standing) upon the planks of his pulpit: "People must cease to neglect the Friday prayers, or else Allah will seal their hearts and then they will be among the unmindful." [Reported by Muslim].

2105450.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105450
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 357
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 357
2105450.text: Narrated Salmah bin Al-Akwa' (RA): We used to offer the Friday prayer with Allah's Messenger (RA) and return (to our homes) while the walls had no shade for us to go under (at that time). [Agreed upon. This is the wording of al-Bukhari].

2105460.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105460
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 358
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 358
2105460.text: And in a narration of Muslim: "We used to offer the Friday prayers with him [Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)] when the sun passed the meridian. We would then return and try to find the afternoon shadow.

2105470.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105470
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 359
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 359
2105470.text: Narrated Sahl bin Sa'd (RA): We would not have a siesta (mid-day nap) nor lunch till after the Friday prayer. [Agreed upon; and the wording is Muslim's].

2105480.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105480
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 360
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 360
2105480.text: Another narration has: "during the life time of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ).

2105490.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105490
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 361
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 361
2105490.text: Narrated Jabir (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was standing while delivering the Khutbah (religious talk, sermon) on Friday when a caravan from Syria arrived. The people flocked towards it till no one was left [with the Prophet (ﷺ)] except twelve men. [Reported by Muslim].

2105500.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105500
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 362
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 362
2105500.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Whoever is in time for a Rak'ah of the Friday prayer, or any other prayer, should add another (Rak'ah) to it and his prayer will then be complete." [an-Nasa'i, Ibn Majah and ad-Daraqutni reported it; the wording is from ad-Daraqutni. Its chain of narrators is Sahih (authentic), but Abu Hatim strengthened the view that it is Mursal (missing link after the Tabi'i)].

2105510.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105510
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 363
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 363
2105510.text: Narrated Jabir bin Samurah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) used to deliver the Khutbah (religious talk, sermon) while standing. He (ﷺ) would then sit down and then stand up and deliver the Khutbah in a standing posture. So, whoever informs you that he [the Prophet (ﷺ)] delivered the Khutbah (religious talk, sermon) while sitting has definitely told a lie. [Reported by Muslim].

2105520.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105520
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 364
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 364
2105520.text: Narrated Jabir bin 'Abdullah (RA): Whenever Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) delivered a Khutbah (religious talk), his eyes would become red, his voice rose and his anger would become intensified, as if he (ﷺ) was like one warning an army and saying, "The enemy has made a morning attack on you. The enemy has made an evening attack on you." He (ﷺ) would also say "Amma ba'du, the best of speech is embodied in the Book of Allah, and the best of guidance is the guidance of Muhammad. And the most evil of affairs are their innovations and every innovation is misguidance." [Reported by Muslim].

2105530.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105530
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 365
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 365
2105530.text: And in a narration of Muslim: "In the Prophet's Khutbah on Friday: He would praise Allah and extol Him. Then, following that, he would say - and he had raised his voice..."

2105540.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105540
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 366
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 366
2105540.text: And in another narration from Muslim: "Whoever Allah guides, no one can lead astray; and whoever Allah leads astray, no one can guide him."

2105550.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105550
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 367
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 367
2105550.text: an-Nasa'i has: "Every misguidance is (a cause to enter) the Fire."

2105560.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105560
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 368
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 368
2105560.text: Narrated 'Ammar bin Yasir (RA): He heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) say: "The length of a man's prayer and the shortness of his Khutbah (religious talk) are a sign of his understanding (of the religion)." [Reported by Muslim].

2105570.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105570
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 369
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 369
2105570.text: Umm Hisham (RA) daughter of Haritha said: I learnt Surat Qaf (Chapter 50) from no other source than the tongue of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) who used to recite it every Friday on the pulpit when he delivered the Khutbah (sermon) to the people." [Reported by Muslim].

2105580.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105580
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 370
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 370
2105580.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Whoever speaks on Friday while the Imam is giving the Khutbah (religious talk), he is like a donkey which carries books; and he who tells him to be quiet has no Jumu'ah." [Reported by Ahmad with an acceptable chain of narrators].

2105590.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105590
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 371
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 371
2105590.text: This Hadith interprets the Marfu' Hadith [attributed to the Prophet (ﷺ)] of Abu Hurairah reported in the Sahihain: On Friday, when the Imam is delivering the Khutbah (religious talk), if you say to your companion to keep quiet, then indeed you have committed a sin (error/something senseless).

2105600.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105600
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 372
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 372
2105600.text: Narrated Jabir (RA): A man entered the mosque on a Friday when the Prophet (ﷺ) was delivering the Khutbah (religious talk, sermon) and he [the Prophet (ﷺ)] said, "Have you prayed? He replied, "No." He [the Prophet (ﷺ)] said, "Stand and pray two Rak'at." [Agreed upon].

2105610.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105610
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 373
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 373
2105610.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) used to recite in Jumu'ah prayer Surat al-Jumu'ah and al-Munafiqun. [Reported by Muslim].

2105620.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105620
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 374
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 374
2105620.text: Narrated Nu'man bin Bashir (RA): He [Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)] used to recite in the two 'Eids and in the Friday prayer: "Sabbih isma Rabbikal-A'la (Surat 87)" and "Hal ataka hadithul-ghashiyah (Surat 88)." [Reported by Muslim].

2105630.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105630
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 375
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 375
2105630.text: Narrated Zaid bin Arqam (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed the 'Eid prayer (on a Friday); and granted a permission (to be excused) from the praying of Friday prayer and said, "Whoever wants to pray it, he may pray." [Reported by al-Khamsah excluding at-Tirmidhi. Ibn Khuzaimah graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2105640.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105640
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 376
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 376
2105640.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "When anyone of you prays the Jumu'ah prayer, he should pray four (optional) Rak'at after it." [Reported by Muslim].

2105650.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105650
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 377
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 377
2105650.text: Narrated as-Sa'ib bin Yazid (RA) that Mu'awiyah (RA) told him, "If you offer the Friday prayer, do not connect it with another prayer, till you talk or go out. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) had commanded us accordingly: That we should not connect a prayer to another prayer till we talk or go out (in between them)." [Reported by Muslim]

2105660.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105660
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 378
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 378
2105660.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Whoever takes a bath, then comes to al-Jumu'ah prayer, then prays what was fixed for him, then keeps silent till the Imam finishes the Khutbah (religious talk - sermon), and then prays along with him - his sins (committed) between that time and the next Friday will be forgiven, with an addition of three days more." [Reported by Muslim].

2105670.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105670
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 379
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 379
2105670.text: Narrated [Abu Hurairah (RA)]: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) mentioned the day of al-Jumu'ah and then said, "There is a time in it (Friday) at which no Muslim would stand up while praying and beg Allah, Who is Great and Glorious, for something except that He would give it to him. He (ﷺ) indicated with his hand that it (this time) is short." [Agreed upon].

2105680.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105680
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 380
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 380
2105680.text: A narration of Muslim has: "This time is brief."

2105690.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105690
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 381
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 381
2105690.text: Narrated Abu Burdah (RA) from his father's: I heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) say, "That time is between the time when the Imam sits down and the end of the prayer." [Reported by Muslim. ad-Daraqutni held that the stronger view is that it is the saying of Abu Burdah].

2105700.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105700
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 382
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 382
2105700.text: Ibn Majah reported from 'Abdullah bin Salam

2105710.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105710
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 383
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 383
2105710.text: and Abu Dawud and an-Nasa'i reported from Jabir: "It is between the 'Asr prayer and sunset."

2105720.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105720
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 384
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 384
2105720.text: More than forty different sayings were narrated about this (special fortune time on Friday), and I have detailed them in (my book) 'Sharh al-Bukhari'.

2105730.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105730
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 385
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 385
2105730.text: Narrated Jabir (RA): It is decided in the Sunnah that the Friday prayer (established/recognized) when forty praying persons or more attend it. [ad-Daraqutni reported it through a weak chain of narrators].

2105740.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105740
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 386
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 386
2105740.text: Narrated Samurah bin Jundub (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) used to ask for (Allah's) forgiveness for the believing men and believing women, every al-Jumu'ah (Friday prayer). [al-Bazzar reported it through a weak chain of narrators].

2105750.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105750
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 387
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 387
2105750.text: Narrated Jabir bin Samurah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) used to recite some verses from the Qur'an in the Friday Khutbah (religious talk - sermon), reminding the people. [Abu Dawud reported it].

2105760.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105760
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 388
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 388
2105760.text: And its basic meaning is in Muslim.

2105770.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105770
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 389
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 389
2105770.text: Narrated Tariq bin Shihab (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The Friday prayer in congregation is an obligatory duty upon every Muslim, with the exception of four: a slave, a woman, a child and a sick person." [Reported by Abu Dawud, who said that Tariq did not hear (any Hadith) from the Prophet (ﷺ)].

2105780.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105780
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 390
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 390
2105780.text: al-Hakim also reported it from the narration of the aforementioned Tariq, who narrated from Abu Musa.

2105790.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105790
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 391
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 391
2105790.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Jumu'ah prayer is not obligatory on a traveller." [Reported by at-Tabarani through a weak chain of narrators].

2105800.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105800
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 392
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 392
2105800.text: Narrated 'Abdullah bin Mas'ud (RA): Whenever Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) ascended the Minbar (to give the Friday Khutbah), we used to face him. [at-Tirmidhi reported it through a weak chain of narrators].

2105810.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105810
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 393
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 393
2105810.text: It has a Shahid (supporting narration) in the Hadith of al-Bara', reported by Ibn Khuzaimah.

2105820.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105820
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 394
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 394
2105820.text: Narrated al-Hakam bin Hazn (RA): We attended the Friday prayer with the Prophet (ﷺ) and he (ﷺ) stood leaning on a staff or a bow. [Reported by Abu Dawud].

2105830.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105830
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 395
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 395
2105830.text: Narrated Salih bin Khawwat on the authority of one who offered the Fear prayer with Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) at the battle of Dhatur-Riqa' that a group (of the army) formed a line along with him and a group faced the enemy. He (ﷺ) led the group which was with him in a Rak'ah, and then remained standing while they finished their prayer by themselves. They then departed and lined up facing the enemy, and the other party came.
