He led them in the remaining Rak'a (of his prayer), after which he remained sitting while they finished their prayer by themselves. He then led them in uttering the Taslim (salutation). [Agreed upon; and this is the wording of Muslim].

2105840.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105840
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 396
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 396
2105840.text: This (Hadith) has been reported in al-Ma'rifah of Ibn Mundah: from Salih ibn Khawwat, from his father.

2105850.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105850
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 397
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 397
2105850.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): I went on an expedition with Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) to Najd, and when we came in front of the enemy we lined up in ranks facing them. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) then stood up and led us in prayer. One group stood up with him while the other faced the enemy. He prayed a Rak'ah with those who were with him and made two prostrations. Then, they changed places with those who had not prayed. When they came Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) prayed a Rak'ah with them and made two prostrations. He then uttered the Taslim (salutation) and each of them got up and prayed a Rak'ah alone and made two prostrations. [Agreed upon, and the wording if from al-Bukhari].

2105860.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105860
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 398
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 398
2105860.text:
Narrated Jabir (RA): "I witnessed Salat-al-Khauf with Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and we lined up in two rows behind him with the enemy between us and the Qiblah. The Prophet (ﷺ) uttered the Takbir and we all uttered it; then he bowed and we all bowed; then he raised his head after bowing and we all raised ours; then he and the row immediately behind him went down in prostration while the rear row stood facing the enemy. Then, when Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) finished the prostration and the row immediately behind him stood up..." then he mentioned the Hadith.

And in a narration "Then he prostrated and the first row prostrated with him. So when they stood, the second row prostrated then the first row went back and the second row came forward..." then he mentioned a similar to it.

And at the end of it "Then the Prophet (ﷺ) uttered the Taslim (salutation) and we all did so." [Reported by Muslim].

2105890.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105890
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 399
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 399
2105890.text: Abu Dawud has reported from Abu 'Aiyash az-Zuraqi similarly, and he added: "it was in Usfan."

2105900.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105900
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 400
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 400
2105900.text: an-Nasa'i reported this narration - through another chain of narrators - from Jabir (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) led a group of his Companions in two Rak'at after which he uttered the Taslim (salutation). Then he led another group in two Rak'at after which he uttered the Taslim (salutation)."

2105910.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105910
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 401
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 401
2105910.text: Abu Dawud has reported similarly from Abu Bakrah (RA).

2105920.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105920
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 402
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 402
2105920.text: Narrated Hudhaifah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) performed Salatal-Khauf leading these (Companions) in one Rak'ah and those (other Companions) in one Rak'ah, and they did not make up the second Rak'ah. [Reported by Ahmad, Abu Dawud and an-Nasa'i. Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2105930.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105930
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 403
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 403
2105930.text: Ibn Khuzaimah has reported it similarly from Ibn 'Abbas (RA).

2105940.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105940
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 404
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 404
2105940.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The prayer in time of danger is one Rak'ah, in whatever manner it is (performed)." [al-Bazzar reported it through a weak chain of narrators].

2105950.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105950
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 405
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 405
2105950.text: Narrated [Ibn 'Umar (RA)]: (This Hadith is) attributed to the Prophet (ﷺ) "There is no Sahw (prostration for forgetfulness) in the prayer in time of danger." [ad-Daraqutni reported it through a weak chain of narrators].

2105960.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105960
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 406
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 406
2105960.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "('Eid) al-Fitr is the day on which the people break the fast, and ('Eid) al-Adha is the day the people offer sacrifices." [Reported by at-Tirmidhi].

2105970.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105970
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 407
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 407
2105970.text: Narrated Abu 'Umair bin Anas bin Malik (RA) on the authority of some of his paternal uncles who were among the Companions, that some riders came and testified that they had seen the new moon the previous day. The Prophet (ﷺ) therefore commanded the people to break the fast and go out to their place of prayer in the morning. [Reported by Ahmad and Abu Dawud. This is Abu Dawud's wording and its Isnad is Sahih (authentic)].

2105980.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105980
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 408
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 408
2105980.text: Narrated Anas (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) would not go out on the day of the breaking of the fast till he ate some dates, which he used to eat in odd numbers. [al-Bukhari reported it].

2105990.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2105990
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 409
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 409
2105990.text: A Mu'allaq narration (broken chain from the side of the Hadith collector, i.e. al-Bukhari) - but connected by Ahmad - has: "and he used to them one by one."

2106000.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106000
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 410
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 410
2106000.text: Narrated Ibn Buraidah on the authority of his father: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) would not go out on the day of breaking of the fast till he had some food, and he would not to take any food on the day of sacrifice till he had prayed (the 'Eid prayer). [Reported by Ahmad and at-Tirmidhi; Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2106010.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106010
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 411
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 411
2106010.text: Narrated Umm 'Atiyah (RA): We were commanded to bring out on 'Eidul-Fitr and 'Eidul-Adha, the young women and the menstruating women to participate in the goodness and supplications of the Muslims. However, the menstruating women would refrain from the (actual) place of prayer. [Agreed upon].

2106020.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106020
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 412
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 412
2106020.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) Abu Bakr and 'Umar (RA) used to offer the 'Eid prayer before the Khutbah (religious talk - sermon). [Agreed upon].

2106030.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106030
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 413
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 413
2106030.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) offered two Rak'at on the day of 'Eid, and did not pray before or after them. [Reported by as-Sab'ah].

2106040.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106040
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 414
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 414
2106040.text: Narrated [Ibn 'Abbas (RA)]: The Prophet (ﷺ) offered the 'Eid prayer without an Adhan or an Iqamah. [Reported by Abu Dawud].

2106050.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106050
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 415
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 415
2106050.text: And its basic meaning is in al-Bukhari.

2106060.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106060
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 416
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 416
2106060.text: Narrated Abu Sa'id (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) never used to offer any prayer before the 'Eid prayer. But when he went back home, he used to pray two Rak'at. [Reported by Ibn Majah through a Hasan (good) chain of narrators].

2106070.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106070
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 417
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 417
2106070.text: Narrated [Abu Sa'id (RA)]: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to go out on the day of the breaking of the fast and the day of sacrifice to the place of prayer, and the first thing he would start with was the prayer. When he finished he would stand facing the people, who were seated in their rows, and he would then preach to them and command them. [Agreed upon].

2106080.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106080
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 418
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 418
2106080.text: Narrated 'Amr bin Shu'aib from his father on the authority of his grand father: The Prophet of Allah (ﷺ) said: "The Takbir in ('Eid) al-Fitr prayer are seven in the first Rak'ah and five in the second, and the recitation of the Qur'an in both is after the Takbir." [Reported by Abu Dawud].

2106090.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106090
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 419
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 419
2106090.text: at-Tirmidhi transmitted its Tashih (grading of authenticity) from al-Bukhari.

2106100.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106100
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 420
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 420
2106100.text: Narrated Abu Waqid al-Laithi (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) used to recite on ('Eid) al-Adha and ('Eid) al-Fitr, Surat Qaf (Chapter 50) and Surat Al-Qamar (Chapter 54). [Reported by Muslim].

2106110.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106110
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 421
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 421
2106110.text: Narrated Jabir (RA): On an 'Eid day, Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) would return by a different road from the one he had taken when going out (for the 'Eid prayer.) [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2106120.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106120
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 422
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 422
2106120.text: Abu Dawud has a similar report from Ibn 'Umar (RA).

2106130.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106130
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 423
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 423
2106130.text: Narrated Anas (RA) that when Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) came to al-Madinah, the people had two days on which they engaged in games. He (ﷺ) said: "Allah has substituted for you something better than them: the day of sacrifice and the day of breaking the fast." [Reported by Abu Dawud and an-Nasa'i; with a Sahih Isnad (authentic chain)].

2106140.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106140
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 424
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 424
2106140.text: Narrated 'Ali (RA): It is Sunnah to go to the 'Eid (prayer) walking. [Reported by at-Tirmidhi who graded it Hasan (good)].

2106150.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106150
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 425
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 425
2106150.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): It rained on an 'Eid day, so the Prophet (ﷺ) led them (the people) in the 'Eid prayer in the mosque. [Reported by Abu Dawud with a Laiyin Isnad (weak chain)].

2106160.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106160
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 426
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 426
2106160.text: Narrated Mughirah bin Shu'bah (RA): That there was a solar eclipse in the time of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) on the day his son Ibrahim died. The people said, "The eclipse of the sun has happened due to the death of Ibrahim." Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The sun and the moon are two of Allah's signs; they are not eclipsed due to the death or the life of anyone. So when you see them (the eclipse of the moon or sun) supplicate to Allah and offer prayers until the eclipse is over." [Agreed upon].

2106170.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106170
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 427
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 427
2106170.text: In a narration of al-Bukhari it has: "till it becomes bright."

2106180.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106180
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 428
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 428
2106180.text: al-Bukhari's narration from Abu Bakrah (RA) has: Pray and supplicate (to Allah) till (the eclipse) is over."

2106190.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106190
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 429
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 429
2106190.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) recited (from the Qur'an) in an audible voice in the prayer at an eclipse, and prayed two Rak'at in which he bowed four times and prostrated four times." [Agreed upon. This is the wording of Muslim].

2106200.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106200
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 430
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 430
2106200.text: In another narration of Muslim: "He (ﷺ) sent an announcer to announce: The prayer is (to be offered) in congregation".

2106210.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106210
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 431
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 431
2106210.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): There was an eclipse of the sun in the life-time of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and then he prayed and stood for a long time, about as long as it would take to recite Surat al-Baqarah. Then, he bowed for a long time, and then he raised his head and stood for a long time, which was less than the first standing. Then, he bowed again for a long time, which was less than the first bowing. Then, he prostrated (twice) and then he stood for a long time, which was less than the first time standing. Then, he bowed for a long time, which was less than the first bowing. Then, he raised his head and stood up for a long time, which was less than the first standing. Then, he bowed for a long time, which was less than the first bowing. Then he prostrated (twice), and then he finished (the prayer), and the sun had become bright. He then delivered a Khutbah (religious talk, sermon). [Agreed upon. And the wording is al-Bukhari's].

2106220.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106220
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 432
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 432
2106220.text: In a narration of Muslim: "When there was an eclipse of the sun, Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) performed eight bowings with four prostrations (in a two Rak'ah prayer for Eclipse)".

2106230.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106230
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 433
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 433

2106240.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106240
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 434
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 434
2106240.text: He also reported from Jabir (RA): "He [Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)] performed six bowings with four prostrations (in a two Rak'ah prayer for Eclipse)."

2106250.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106250
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 435
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 435
2106250.text: Narrated Ubai bin Ka'b (RA): "He [the Prophet (ﷺ)] prayed (the Eclipse prayer) and bowed five times and prostrated twice (in the first Rak'ah), and in the second Rak'a he also did the same." [Abu Dawud]

2106260.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106260
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 436
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 436
2106260.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): No wind ever blew without the Prophet (ﷺ) getting down on his knees and saying, "O Allah, make it a mercy and do not make it a punishment." [Reported by ash-Shafi'i and at-Tabarani].

2106270.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106270
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 437
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 437
2106270.text: Narrated [Ibn 'Abbas (RA)]: He [the Prophet (ﷺ)] prayed during an earthquake six bowings and four prostrations, and said, "This is the way the Prayer of the Signs (of Allah) is offered. [Reported by al-Baihaqi].

2106280.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106280
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 438
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 438
2106280.text: ash-Shafi'i reported a similar Hadith without its end through 'Ali bin Abu Talib (RA).

2106290.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106290
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 439
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 439
2106290.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) went out (of al-Madinah, to pray for rain) humbling (himself), wearing rough clothes, submissive, walking slowly, supplicating (Allah). Then, he offered two Rak'at in the same way he prayed 'Eid, but did not deliver your kind of Khutbah (religious talk, sermon). [Reported by al-Khamsah; and at-Tirmidhi, Abu 'Awanah and Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2106300.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106300
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 440
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 440
2106300.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): The people complained to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) of the lack of rain. So, he gave orders for a minbar, which was put for him at the prayer place. He then fixed a day for the people to come out. And he (ﷺ) came out when the edge of the sun appeared, sat down on the Minbar pronounced the greatness of Allah and expressed His praise. Then, he said, "You have complained of drought in your abodes. Allah has ordered you to supplicate Him, and promised that He would answer (your supplications)." Then he (ﷺ) said: All Praise is due to Allah, the Rabb (Lord) of the universe, the Compassionate, the Merciful, the Master of the Day of Judgement; nothing deserves to be worshipped except Allah, Who does what He wills. O Allah! You are Allah, nothing deserves to be worshipped except You; You are the Rich, and we are the poor; send down rain upon us and make what You send down strength and satisfaction for a time." He (ﷺ) then raised his hands and kept rising them till the whiteness of his armpits was visible. He then turned his back to the people and inverted his cloak while keeping his hands raised. He (ﷺ) then faced the people, descended and prayed two Rak'at. Then, Allah produced a cloud and storms of thunder and lightning came and the rain fell. [Reported by Abu Dawud who graded it Gharib (transmitted through a single narrator), but its chain is Jayyid (good)].

2106310.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106310
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 441
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 441
2106310.text: The story of how the Prophet (ﷺ) inverted his cloak is mentioned in Sahih al-Bukhari from the narration of 'Abdullah bin Zaid. And it contains (the words): "He (ﷺ) faced the Qiblah making supplication. Then, he prayed two Rak'at, reciting (the Qur'an) in them audibly."

2106330.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106330
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 442
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 442
2106330.text: ad-Daraqutni reported from the Mursal Hadith of Abu Ja'far al-Baqir: "He (ﷺ) turned his cloak round, so that the drought may turn [from dry land to rained land).

2106340.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106340
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 443
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 443
2106340.text: Narrated Anas (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) was delivering the Khutbah (religious talk, sermon) while standing on a Friday when a man came into the mosque and said, "O Messenger of Allah! The livestock have died and the roads are cut off, so supplicate Allah to send us down rain." Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) raised his hands and then said, "O Allah! send us down rain, O Allah! send us down rain, O Allah! send us down rain." And the reporter mentioned the complete Hadith, which contains supplication to stop the rain. [Agreed upon].

2106350.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106350
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 444
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 444
2106350.text: Narrated [Anas (RA)]: When they experienced drought 'Umar bin al-Khattab (RA) used to seek rain by asking al-'Abbas bin 'Abdul Muttalib (RA) to supplicate Allah for rain. He ('Umar) would say: 'O Allah, we used to ask our Prophet (RA) to supplicate to You for rain, and You would give us rain. We are now asking our Prophet's uncle to supplicate to You for rain, so give us rain." They would then be given rain. [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2106360.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106360
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 445
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 445
2106360.text: Narrated [Anas (RA)]: Rain fell upon us while we were with Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). He opened his garment till some of the rain fell upon him. He then said, "It has only recently been created by its Rabb." [Reported by Muslim].

2106370.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106370
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 446
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 446
2106370.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): When the Prophet (ﷺ) saw rain he said, "O Allah, (send down) a beneficial downpour." [Agreed upon].

2106380.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106380
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 447
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 447
2106380.text: Narrated Sa'd (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) supplicated (Allah) for rain saying, "O Allah, cover all the land with accumulated, thundering, plunging and lightening clouds from which You would send us down a showery, drizzly, and pouring rain. O Possessor of Glory and Honour." [Reported by Abu 'Awanah in his Sahih].

2106390.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106390
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 448
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 448
2106390.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Sulaiman (AS) (Solomon - Peace be upon him) went out to pray for rain, and he saw an ant lying on its back, raising its legs to the sky saying: "O Allah, we are creatures among your creatures, we cannot live without your water." He said (to his companions), "Go back, for you have been given water through the supplication of others." [Reported by Ahmad and al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2106400.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106400
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 449
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 449
2106400.text: Narrated Anas (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed for rain pointing the back of his palms to the sky. [Reported by Muslim].

2106410.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106410
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 450
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 450
2106410.text: Narrated Abu 'Aamir al-Ash'ari: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "There will be among my followers some people who will consider dultery (al-Hir) and the use of silk (al-Harir) lawful." [Reported by Abu Dawud, and its basic meaning is in al-Bukhari].

2106420.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106420
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 451
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 451
2106420.text: Narrated Hudhaifah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade us from eating and drinking from gold and silver vessels, and from wearing or siting upon silk or brocade. [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2106430.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106430
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 452
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 452
2106430.text: Narrated 'Umar (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade the wearing of silk except the space of two or three or four fingers. [Agreed upon, and the wording is from Muslim].

2106440.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106440
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 453
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 453
2106440.text: Narrated Anas (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) gave permission to 'Abdur-Rahman bin 'Auf and az-Zubair to wear silk during the journey because of an itching which they suffered from. [Agreed upon].

2106450.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106450
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 454
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 454
2106450.text: Narrated 'Ali bin Abi Talib (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) presented me a silk suit of clothing. I went out wearing it, but on noticing anger on his face, I cut it up (and divided it) among the women of my household. [Agreed upon, and this is the wording of Muslim].

2106460.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106460
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 455
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 455
2106460.text: Narrated Abu Musa (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Gold and silk are lawful for the females among my followers, but prohibited to the males". [Reported by Ahmad, an-Nasa'i and at-Tirmidhi, who graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2106470.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106470
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 456
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 456
2106470.text: Narrated 'Imran bin Husain (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "When Allah grants His blessings to His servant, He loves to see the traces of His favour upon him." [Reported by al-Baihaqi].

2106480.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106480
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 457
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 457
2106480.text: Narrated 'Ali (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade wearing of silk and clothes dyed with safflower (a red dye). [Reported by Muslim].

2106490.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106490
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 458
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 458
2106490.text: Narrated 'Abdullah bin 'Amr (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) saw me in two clothes dyed in safflower (a red dye), whereupon he said: "Did your mother order you to do this?" [Reported by Muslim].

2106500.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106500
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 459
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 459
2106500.text: Narrated Asma' bint Abu Bakr (RA): She brought out the mantle (over-garment) of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)) with it's collar, sleeves, front and back hemmed with brocade (silk). [Abu Dawud reported it].

2106510.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106510
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 460
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 460
2106510.text: Its basic meaning is in Muslim's Sahih with the addition: "It was with 'Aishah (RA) till she died, then I took possession of it. The Prophet (ﷺ) used to wear it, and we wash it for the sick, seeking cure by means of it."

2106520.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2106520
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 461
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 461
2106520.text: al-Bukhari added in Adab al-Mufrad: "He [the Prophet (ﷺ)] used to wear it on the visit of a delegation and on Fridays."
